characters: PLASTIC THREE KINGS AND BABY JESUS

dialogues.speaker: FIRST KILL
dialogues.text: Flat grey sky. The CAMERA is running forward, TOWARD a big sand berm in the distance. There are 0.S. sounds: soldier's EQUIPMENT CLANKING, BOOTS RUNNING ON SAND. Hear a man's BREATHING. The back of his helmeted head and his uniformed shoulders appear in the BOTTOM OF the FRAME, running. This is TROY BARLOW, Sergeant, U.S. Army, 25 years old. On his helmet is a photo-button with a photo of a newborn baby. Suddenly, on the sand berm 100 meters ahead, an Iraqi soldier stands. Troy stops in his tracks, out of breath, and stares at the figure on the berm. The Iraqi flutters a white flag over his head, then puts it down and picks up a gun. Troy turns around, we see his face for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Are we shooting people, or what?

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Are we shooting?

dialogues.speaker: TORY
dialogues.text: That's what I'm asking you.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: What's the answer?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I_don't know the answer. That's what I'm trying to find out. PAN TO 100 yards away -- ZOOM IN -- SOLDIER #2 stands with his head tilted back while SOLDIER #3 looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: It looks like a grain of sand, but I don't know how I'm gonna get it out -- PAN TO three soldiers 40 yards away -- ZOOM IN -- SOLDIER #4 unwraps a stick of gum and puts it into his mouth. SOLDIERS #5 and #6, plus CONRAD VIG, 22, wiry, intense, deep South, and WALTER WOGOMAN, 19, quiet, tall, Southern, put out their hands and get pieces of gum. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TROY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think this guy has a weapon. The Soldiers get ready with their guns, scared. CAPTAIN VAN METER, 37, crab-like, is in the far distance.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: If they surrender, don't shoot, if they don't surrender, blow ‘em away. PAN BACK TO Troy, faces the CAMERA, CLOSE, scared, then turns back to the dune and runs a few yards. Stops and stares, raises his rifle. He aims at the figure on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Iraqi soldier in Troy's sight post, holding a rifle up. Hear Troy's BREATHING, loud, as he pulls trigger slowly. SLOW MOTION RIFLE sound. Silent pause. The Iraqi soldier stands there, then his neck explodes like a sack of blood. Silent, except for sound of Troy's LOUD BREATHING as he walks TOWARD the big berm, and UP TO the crest. All we hear are his FOOTSTEPS and BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: That guy just shot an A-rab.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG IRAQI SOLDIER
dialogues.text: lies on the ground. A piece of his neck is blown away. He is rasping, a white flag is clasped in one hand; a rifle in the other. He is looking up at Troy, who looks down at him.

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY
dialogues.text: A white baby girl, covered in blood and placenta, is pulled from between the legs of Troy's wife, DEBBIE. The nurse holds the SCREAMING BABY aloft, proud and happy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VIG, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (deep Southern accent) Congratulations, you got yourself a Eye-raqi, my man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN TO Conrad Vig.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Dag. PAN FROM dead Iraqi TO Troy, upset, as he murmurs "I Get Around" by the BEACH BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: ‘Gettin’ bugged drivin’ up and down the same old strip, gotta find a new place where the kids are hip, I get around -- '

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: I didn't think I'd see anyone get shot over here.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Take my picture.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Do you still want to sell pictures?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (distracted monotone) For twenty.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Twenty dollars for a hoo-a shot, man, what's the meaning of life?

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: What an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You're lucky you got to see anybody shot in this war.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Been over five days, Jim, ain't gonna be much more of this.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Bobby, take my picture. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the camera out.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: If he shot the guy, it's up to him.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: It's not like he shot a fucking deer. It's the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Troy's enemy, yours for twenty. Soldiers get their cash out, Vig takes it.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Show some respect for the dead.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Yeah, leave him in peace. SOLDIER #5 bends next to the corpse and holds his camera out at arm's length.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: No free pictures, motherfucker. Vig shoves the soldier away and the two wrestle as they roll down the sand berm. "I Just Want to Celebrate" by RARE EARTH comes on loud. Troy walks away holding his temple in pain; Soldiers gather to stare at the dead Iraqi, getting their cameras out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American soldiers in combat gear dance on a road in the desert. "I JUST WANT TO CELEBRATE" BLARES as the CAMERA DOLLIES THROUGH the soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY INTO tent town, PAST bare-chested soldiers pumping free weights; jogging in formation; sunbathing on big water storage mattresses.  5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY OUT of tent town, PAST a lone boom operator, PAST three soldiers at piss tubes, as MUSIC CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Spirits are high and the music is boisterous as these young troops celebrate -- shit. Let me try that again. DOLLY AROUND the dancing soldiers to see: 36 stripped Iraqi solders lying face down in undershorts.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Spirits are high and the music is motherfucking sand in my eye -- PAN TO CNN reporter ADRIANA CRUZ, 45, in white safari jacket over Desert Storm fatigues, cleaning her eye; nearby a cluster of rowdy soldiers who are mugging into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Spirits are high and the music is soaring as these young troops -- did I just say ‘soaring'? PAN TO cameraman, PACO.

dialogues.speaker: PACO
dialogues.text: I think you said soaring.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Did I or didn't I? DOLLY TO ARCHIE GATES, 40, Major, Special Forces, wearing sunglasses.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You said ‘soaring.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: How did it sound?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Like bullshit. But this is a bullshit story.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: The end of the war's a bullshit story?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Saddam's still here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: This is a huge win.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: How about the Shiites?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Arab versus Arab won't play for the network right now.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: How about the gold thing?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: I don't have anything on that.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Okay, forget it, tape these guys over here. Cathy, what's up? Archie and CATHY DAITCH, 30, another reporter, walk off.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You don't need me for this.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: They won't let me go anywhere without an escort, goddamn it.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere, you're doing the celebration story.

dialogues.speaker: ROWDY SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: mug for Cruz's camera.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We're number one.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Wee-ha.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: You're heroes.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We're heroes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Give war a chance.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: You exorcised the ghosts of Vietnam with a clear moral imperative --

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Is that what we did?

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We kicked ass. We're number one.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We didn't get rid of fucking Saddam --

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Which totally sucks a big dick.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Those people are getting reamed --

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Bullshit, we saved Kuwait, man.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Who's getting reemed?

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: I don't know who they are --

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We got huge firepower and we ain't helping --

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: It's fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Fuck that, we liberated Kuwait.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Weee-haaa. Adriana watches impassively. WHIP PAN TO: five soldiers chant Lee Greenwood's anthem, "Proud to Be An American," into Cruz's camera -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: (chant) ‘If tomorrow all the things were gone that I worked for all my life and I had to start again with just my children and my wife --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLYING CRANE of tent city.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIERS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (chant) ‘I'd thank my lucky stars to --

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER
dialogues.text: “PROUD TO BE AN AMERICAN" BLASTS, CHOPPER PILOTS sing off key.

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER PILOTS
dialogues.text: -- be livin' here today because the flag still stands for freedom and they can't take that awayyyyy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy, wearing a checked Arab headdress, is paraded on shoulders. He holds up a Coke in one hand and Pepsi can in the other, like torches.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (screaming the song) And I'm proud to be an American, where at least I know I'm free. And I won't forget the men who died, who gave that right to me. And I'd gladly stand up; next to you and defend her still today. ‘Cause there ain't no doubt I love this land, God bless the U.S.A. -- Soldiers scream and go nuts. Soda is sputtered and spit. "I Can't Do Nothing For Ya Man" by PUBLIC ENEMY BLASTS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter Wogoman operates two parallel boom boxes like a DJ A soldier rapidly peels down one Bruce Lee poster on top of another, like a flip-book animating Bruce Lee. Vig, wearing a bandage across his nose from the fight on the berm, does a series of cheerleader-like karate arm movements. Troy dances. Soldiers whip brightly-painted toy footballs at Troy. He whips the balls back, is tackled over a table, crashes. Soldiers -- Vig, Walter, others -- scream viscerally as the music blasts. Two soldiers fire their fingers like pistols at Troy on the floor screaming like a fierce animal.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Rahhhhhhhhhhhhhh. Vig screams into Troy's face at point-blank range.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Rahhhhhhhhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Rahhhhhhhhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie madly humps Cathy, slamming into TV monitors.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: You are a trained warrior, trained warrior, Jesus Christ, Major Gates! Monitors crash to the floor as Cathy climaxes. Archie rolls to the side and stares at TV images of celebrating soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: (out of breath) What's Adriana got?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Just the celebration.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: That's it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: I got something on the gold.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: They think it could be in some bunkers.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: There's thousands of bunkers in Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: Why don't you stay and help me figure it out, I had some shrimp flown in --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I gotta keep an eye on Adriana --

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: Boy, she really gets the full baby-sitting service, doesn't she?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You all do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, and COLONEL HORN, 45, stands there, with Adriana Cruz behind, pissed. Cathy grabs her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: I was about to ask you the same question, Major.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: You said he was former Delta, he'd take great care of me, what a bunch of bullshit -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Would you please let me handle this?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Doesn't she have her own goddamn escort?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Of course she does.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM, MOUSY WOMAN SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Embarrassed, stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Why don't you give her someone she can fuck so she'll leave my escort alone?

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: That is really unnecessary.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: I don't want him walking away from me, giving my stories away --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What stories? You don't have any stories.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: You don't fucking tell people that --

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: Look at yourself, my God, you're pathetic --

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Look at me? Is that what you're saying, with your panties around your ears?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: I really don't need this shit. Archie just looks at Horn silently.  10 11 12 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIEF ELGIN is 29, stocky, black, no nonsense, shouts.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Captain's coming. MUSIC STOPS, beer is hidden. Soldiers scurry to get ready.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: paces. Chief hands him papers.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Let's all try to picture the marksmanship, the focus, the mastery of fear, required to shoot across 500 meters --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It might've been more like 250 --

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Maybe 400.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Blew the guy's head three feet into the air -- Soldiers cheer. Troy is embarrassed -- then cheers --

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: the Iraqi soldier's head pops into the air.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: A-rab kept talking after he hit the ground --

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Anybody see Predator, where the black guy -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Carl Weathers. His arm gets shot off --

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: While he's still firing his gun --

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: And when his arm hits the ground --

dialogues.speaker: WALTER AND VAN METER
dialogues.text: His hand keeps on firing.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Did you see the guy with his ear hanging off, sir?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Arnold Schwarzenegger or Carl Weathers?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No, I heard it happened here.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Whatever, we'll be going home soon, and tomorrow we round up more Eye-Ragis. They all cheer.
12 13 14 15 Hundreds of Iraqis walking in the desert, hands raised above their heads.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATOR
dialogues.text: (megaphone, in Arabic) Lay down your weapons, get down on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: We will not hurt you. Lay down your weapons, get on the ground -- Two tagged Iraqis with bad face wounds get medical help. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Five Iraqis on their knees, plead for mercy in Arabic as they disrobe. They grab and kiss Troy Barlow's hand, as he holds his M-16 on the begging Iraqis. Walter tags a few.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It's cool, no one's gonna hurt you -- Vig whips out his big Thunder 5 pistol, points it at them.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Did you rape and torture anybody in Kuwait, Abdul? The Iraqis wail for mercy. Troy pushes Vig's pistol away.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: You're making them all hysterical, and you're gonna get busted for having that pistol. Vig points the big pistol at an older IRAQI OFFICER who is the only one not taking his clothes off.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Take your fucking rags off, take these off. No comprende English, motherfucker?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What is your fucking problem, Conrad? Could you act in a more professional manner, please?

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm just tryin’ git him to obey the spirit of things. I want to be professional about it.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (leans down) Sir? We need you to disrobe like all the other A-rabs, okay? The Officer does not move.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I hate to see it come to this. Vig and Walter forcibly pull the Iraqi Officer's pants off. Troy turns to the other prisoners. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Stay down, it's gonna be all right.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hey. Troy looks at the Officer's bare buttocks, where a rolled up piece of paper is sticking out --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: There's a document in that guy's ass.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: We got a classified situation.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Do you think he ate it?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It wouldn't come out perfect like that if he ate it. Troy pulls a latex glove out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Pull it out, private.

dialogues.speaker: IRAQI OFFICER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) No! Stop! Get the fuck off me. The Officer screams in protest and is forcibly subdued by Walter as Vig, wearing the glove, slowly pulls the rolled-up, greasy paper from the Officer's ass -- Troy looks disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Open it up.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: You only gave me one glove.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I don't have another glove, but you gotta open it up. That's how the chain of command works. Vig takes out a U.S. Army pen and uses it to unroll the greasy paper and lie it flat on the sand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RUMPLED PAPER
dialogues.text: It is a handwritten map, with scant Arabic writing, a few spare roads, numbers, and three small boxes.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Important enough to squeeze your cheeks for.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Hey, look at this --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Back up, motherfuckers -- Vig pushes Berm Solider #1 and another soldier as they rubberneck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie sits on a folding chair facing COLONEL HORN, 45, who is furious. Soldiers and vehicles pass.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: You're supposed to make her feel good about the stories we want, not push stories we don't want, and you don't walk away from her to fuck another journalist.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I never wanted this job, Ron.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: It's a great job, Arch, your work in Iraq was over, I'm trying to help you out.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I don't even know what we did over here.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Don't even start that with me, because this has been a huge success.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You got your star clinched. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: (touches his collar) It's not my fault you plateaued a long time ago, big-mouthed N.C.O. at heart.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Just tell me what we did here, Ron.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: You want to occupy Iraq and do Vietnam again, is that what you want?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Fuck it, I'm retiring, anyway. I don't care.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Until you do, you're an Army officer, and you're still taking care of that reporter, so do it right. Maybe she'll hook you up to consult with the media at home.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Fuck that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLASH -- rubbing alcohol is poured over Vig's extended hand by Chief.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: You've washed your hands like a thousand times, Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Lord knows what vermin live in the butt of a dune koon.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Don't say that around me.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Captain uses them terms.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Why do you let this cracker follow you around? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: He's all right, man, he's got no high school, he's from a group home in Jackson --

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Don't tell people that.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit if he's from Johannesburg. I don't want to hear dune koon or sand nigger from him or anybody.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Okay, how about camel jockey and towel head, hoo-wa?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I apologize but it's a little confusing with all that anti- Iraqi, pro-Saudi, and all that language.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Did you get those aerial photos?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Yeah, I got ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I have my ways.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Chief is hooked up.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Keep Walter on the door.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Would you take those fucking things off? Walter stands by the door wearing night vision goggles. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I never got to use night vision.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: They don't work during the day --

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, they kind of work.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Just stand outside the tent so Chief can translate my Iraqi ass map, okay? Chief unfolds a big aerial-photo map of the Iraqi desert, next to the rumpled ass map.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: You ready to work with me now?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm ready to work with you now.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Good, because I have a story and you're gonna get it for me.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: 18A EXT. MINE FIELD NEAR CAMP —- DAY 18A

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: It_was in the guy's ass.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: That's not the real story. Archie and Adriana follow soldiers picking up mines and placing them in a box; a TRUCK GRINDS by; they have to shout.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: What's the real story?

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: It was in the guy's dick. They pulled it out with tweezers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: A_ten-page atlas of Saddam's bunkers?

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: But real small like those little books you get in Cracker Jacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They talk with TEEBAUX, a French soldier taking a bath.

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: They pull eet out the guy's ear.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: What guy?

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: I cannot tell you.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: You said you could tell us.

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Not now. Archie pulls her off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: He's French Special Forces, he can help us but he's not gonna talk to me if you're around.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: You better not be fucking with me.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I'm not, I'll bring it to you.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: I want the story this time, Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I said you'll get it, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP: Aerial map next to ass map. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: These are definitely Saddam's bunkers between Karbala and Nazaria.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What's inside?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: According to Intel, Picasso, Sony, Rolex, Armani. Kuwait was Arab Beverly Hills and Saddam sacked it.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It would be nice to bring something home besides sand fleas --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Whatever, the good Lord put this map in our path and we're gonna find something --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: He could also put a land mine in our path if we go out there --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you're safe with me, I was fire baptized.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I have a ring of Jesus fire to guide my decisions.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm not following this. You're putting me on, right?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: For those who understand, no explanation is necessary; for those who don't, no explanation will suffice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOWN-OUT POV of Walter's night vision -- BLURRY IMAGE of Archie walking right up to Walter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Sir, sir, excuse me, sir, this tent is restricted --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Mayday, Mayday --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Chief scramble to put the maps under the table as they stand to attention.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Good afternoon. He looks them over.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Would this be the proctology tent?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, I mean, no, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Then maybe it's the urology tent, or the neurology tent, or the ear, nose and throat tent.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Captain's at a staff meeting, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Is the captain a urologist or a proctologist? They look puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. I'm not looking for the Captain, I'm looking for Sergeant Barlow. Archie pushes his finger into Troy's name tape, reaches under the table, and takes the map, smells his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You're on the path to truth when you smell shit, isn't that what they say?  23 24 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter, outside the tent, practices blocking positions, and his eyes are messed up from too much brightness.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Damn. Freeze. Do not pass. Hold it, freeze. Stop. Freeze.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I don't recognize you, sir. Are you in this division?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: He's not in this division. He's Special Forces. CLOSEUP - ARCHIE'S S.F. Crossed Arrows and Special Forces patch. They look at Archie, intimidated.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Did you good soldiers present this map to your Captain?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Not yet, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I'll take it to him.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: That's not necessary, sir. We'll take it to him. He's our C.O. He tries to pull the map, Archie puts him in a wrist lock.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Don't get grabby, Sergeant. He stares at Troy, who's in pain.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: He's our C.0O., sir, we'll have to tell him you took it.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: It won't do either of us any good then, will it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They all look at him. Archie lets go, looks at the map.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What do you see here?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Bunkers, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What do you think is inside the bunkers?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Stuff they stole from Kuwait.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Bullshit. I'm talking about 700 million in Kuwaiti bullion. They all look at him for a moment while it sinks in.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: You mean those little bullion cubes you put in hot water for soup?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No, not the little bullion cubes you put in hot water for soup.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Gold bricks. Archie stares at each of them.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES,
dialogues.text: Saddam stole it from the sheiks, I have no problem stealing it from Saddam. My guess is that he divided his bricks into many different stashes. Just one stash should be easy to take from his surrendering army, and that would be enough to get us out of our day jobs, unless you reservists are in love with your day job. DOLLY: Troy, Chief, Vig stare at Archie.

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY
dialogues.text: Silent -- Troy kneels at a disassembled photocopier, tools and parts all around him, opens a bag of toner, which spills black dust all over his white shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent -- Chief wears the uniform of a baggage loader as he drives along the tarmac in baggage carrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig FIRES his PISTOLS with fury at a series of stuffed animals on logs -- blowing the stuffed animals to smithereens. END OF FANTASY.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I don't really have a day job.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: First we have to be sure the map is more than a love letter from one Iraqi to another.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It's a series of bunkers near Karbala, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Definitely, sir. Recon photos match. Archie holds the map up to the light. He puts the map on the table, turns the light off and clicks on an ultra- violet flashlight he pulls out. A completely different map appears in green markings.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Dag. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: That's why S.F. is so badass, we get the best flashlights. Still looks like a series of bunkers in three villages. A bit farther to the east.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Seventy-five klicks north.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: More like 65.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: That's north of any allied troops, we can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It's perfect, we don't want any troops around.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What about mines?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: The grid was swept by the 82nd, but we'll stick to the roads. Leave at dawn, back by lunch. Take a little French leave, we shouldn't be missed, but I'1l have a friend occupy your C.O. just to be sure. What's the guy's name outside?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Walter.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Bolo, come in here. Walter comes in.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You will tell Adriana Cruz I've gone ahead and checked things out, and you're taking her to meet me.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: In Iraq? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 29 30 31 THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98 27.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No. I'll give you a fake copy of this map. You will then take her on a ride that lasts all morning and takes her nowhere near the villages outside Karbala. When you don't find me it's because you got lost, is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. How do I get her out of here?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You're gonna take a Chennowth with a radio and drive her out. I'll call you if I need you. Any other questions?

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Is it true you got to cut off an enemy ear to be Special Forces?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Are you able to control him?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: He'll be fine, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I'll see you at West Gate in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN 30
dialogues.text: Three figures in fatigues crouch low to the ground as they run to a Chennowth dune buggy. Walter STARTS the ENGINE. PACO the cameraman sits behind Walter with a video camera. Adriana Cruz crouches in with a satellite phone and dramatically gives Walter the thumb's up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bach's "GLORIA," from Mass in B Minor plays as:

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Pull. Troy throws a painted football into the desert. Chief FIRES his M-16 and blows the ball to pieces. Archie drives, playing BACH on the CD PLAYER. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 31 THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98 27A. CONTINUED: (Al) 31 This humvee is loaded with weaponry and gear, a mounted 60 mm machine gun, a Bart Simpson doll on the grill. A second humvee leads the way, driven by Archie, PLAYING the BACH. Two humvees roll into the vast desert, littered with burned-out tanks, black craters, overturned vehicles, no people.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Troy throws another ball, Chief BLOWS it away.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Pull. Chief throws a football from the moving humvee, Troy FIRES an M-16 and misses the ball as it bounces to the desert.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I gave you a better arc, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I threw the ball in a higher arc that was easier for you to hit.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: (driving) Blacks make better receivers than quarterbacks.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Stop speaking right now, Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Warren Moon will kick any ofay quarterback's ass.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: The Oilers have gone nowhere behind Warren Moon.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Randall Cunningham.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Don't get down in the mud with him, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: The Eagles will never get to the Superbowl with Cunningham.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Doug Williams took the Redskins to the Superbowl and won, okay? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: We can all agree there are many excellent black quarterbacks. Chief throws a ball. Vig FIRES his giant PISTOL, misses.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Hit it, you sorry-assed cracker, you ain't never gonna hit an Eye- raqi.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I'll shoot an Eye-raqi, I'll blow his head off. Vig FIRES his big PISTOL while he drives: BLAM, BLAM BLAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humvee ahead stops abruptly; Vig JAMS on the BRAKES; Troy and Chief fall down. Archie sits, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: You said we could fire some rounds when we were far away from camp, sir. Archie gets out and starts walking.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Come here. They follow him to the side of the road, where a dead body lies next to a bomb crater while a skinny cow loiters nearby.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Is this what you're after? Archie picks up a rusted metal rod and pushes it into the bloated corpse with a HISS of GAS escaping. They pull back and cover their mouths and noses. Chief wretches, Troy backs up and trips over an arm sticking out of the sand.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We dropped a lot of bombs out here. We also buried guys alive.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What do you mean we buried guys alive? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Bradleys with big plows broke through the berm and buried the trenches.

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY
dialogues.text: A huge plow on the front of a Bradley pushes sand right TOWARD the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They had the option to surrender, but they chose to die for their country. DOLLY INTO three terrified Iraqis, eyes open with fear, as the sand rolls over them. END OF FANTASY.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Damn, we missed that, only action we seen was on C.N.N., ‘cept for that guy Troy shot. Archie takes Vig's giant revolver, empties the chambers.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Shot him in the neck, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: That's right, sir.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I was there and it was amazing. Vig swings his arms in his pseudo-karate routine.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Do you know anything about gunshot wounds? They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What makes any gunshot wound bad, provided you survive the bullet, is something called sepsis. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Infection of the blood.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Say a bullet tears into you right now --

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY
dialogues.text: A soldier in a T-shirt stands in an open area, a bullet hits him in the side. CAMERA SWOOPS IN as shirt and skin are snapped away like handkerchiefs, REVEALING his insides pierced by a bullet in SLOW MOTION --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It creates a cavity of dead tissue, the cavity fills up with bile and bacteria and you're fucked. END OF FANTASY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Then you got the kind of wound that paralyzes or castrates or has a scary name like tension pneumo thorax. That's when a bullet pierces your lung, so every time you breathe, air leaks into your chest cavity, and it fills up like a balloon, crushing your heart, your liver, your lung. Your own breathing kills you, one breath at a time. They look at the corpse.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: But we're going to do this without firing any bullets. And just to be sure, we're gonna do a dry run, so put your suits on.  37 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Chief sit in the parked first humvee, Vig behind the wheel. Archie sits behind the wheel of the second humvee. They all wear anti-gas suits.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Violence of action means your movement is so decisive and powerful, the enemy is frozen and you haven't fired a single shot. We'll say the cow is the primary guard outside the bunker. We pull up fast, stop short, move very aggressively. At last cover, I'm the base of fire.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: And -- Go. The two HUMVEES ROAR down the road; Archie stops the rear humvee, drops down, aims his rifle. The cow stares as the first humvee pulls up fast and stops. Troy and Chief jump out, weapons drawn, flank the cow -- The COW steps back, and EXPLODES. Troy and Chief stand splattered with cow entrails. The COW'S HEAD LANDS with a THUD on the hood of the humvee.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Who's hurt?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: It's all cow, I think.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's all cow. He picks cow entrails off himself.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Ka-boom, ya'll see that cow's head shoot up, just like Wile E. Coyote man --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: You said this was swept for mines.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: That wasn't a mine, it was a cluster bomb, very hard to see. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He inspects a gaping hole in the front grill of the lead humvee, the radiator is shot, a hoof imbedded in it.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. A piece of cow flesh lands on his shoulder, he looks up. He hears Troy singing quietly.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: ‘My buddies and me are gettin' real well known, the bad guys know us and they leave us alone -- '

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: He just had a baby daughter and it's like he wants a envelope a safety inna world -- Archie looks at them as Vig talks and Troy sings.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Move the gear to the other humvee, leave your safeties on, Vig put that stupid pistol away, Troy's the base of fire, no shooting, we hit them with the blinding power of American sunshine. Help me, Rhonda.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 38
dialogues.text: "I Get Around" by the BEACH BOYS BLASTS as the humvee speeds along. A big American flag flaps in the breeze from a pole at the back of the Hummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humvee drives fast into a village piazza with an old fortress at one end. Vig drives as the humvee speeds around the town square, zooming past scared Shiites in black robes, a few skinny dogs, a few bewildered Iraqi soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Where's the bunker?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: It should be right -- He studies the map and points to the gas station with soldiers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: There. Vig jerks the wheel right. They drive fast.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No -- there. Archie points left. Vig jerks the wheel left, past the village well and two calm peasants, and drives straight toward the fortress with two Iraqi soldiers in front. Troy drops out of the moving humvee, to his belly, aims his rifle. Iraqi soldiers look scared as the humvee drives up, like it's going to hit them, and stops, flag fluttering in the breeze. Vig stands and speaks into a megaphone as he mans the 60mm.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: We are the Army of the United States of America. We are here to protect you. Remain calm. Archie and Chief leap from the humvee with weapons drawn and their free hands held up in a "halt" sign. The two Iraqi guards look stunned as Archie and Chief take their machine guns and put the Iraqis face down on the ground. They pull out plastic twist-handcuffs, as used in urban riots. Archie holds up a thick white document.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: (hands up) Orders from President Bush, step aside. Troy runs forward when a gaunt MOTHER, with a baby in her arms, opens her blouse, revealing her small breasts. Other peasants gather.

dialogues.speaker: IRAQI MOTHER WITH BABY
dialogues.text: No milk. Baby milk. Troy looks shocked until Archie suddenly pushes him past the Iraqi Mother and to the door of the bunker, which Chief holds.  40 41 42 43 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five Iraqi soldiers look disoriented and scared as they hold their hands up in the air, stare at the cow blood on Troy and Chief's uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Do not panic. Step outside --

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: (into megaphone) We are here for your protection and _ safety. Iraqi women and children kiss Vig's feet. The five Iraqi soldiers exit the bunker with their hands raised, and the starved civilians spit and throw stones at them while "I GET AROUND" KEEPS PLAYING. A CIVILIAN man shouts from a megaphone on the roof. Vig looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CIVILIAN MAN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) The Americans are here, it is safe to fight now.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Y'all be cool now, this is the U. Military in charge here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie runs down the narrow stairs of the bunker, followed by Troy and Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief lashes the Stern Iraqi soldier's hands behind his back and cuffs him. Troy SHOOTS the door lock with his PISTOL. Then backs up and gives it a running shoulder. The door doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Shit. He holds his shoulder in pain. Archie kicks the door repeatedly. Troy joins him, it finally flies open.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Freeze. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Troy is embraced by a FRIENDLY IRAQI soldier, about 25.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: I am love United States of Freedom. I am hate Saddam. Troy tries some karate moves, jerking his elbows to dislodge the Iraqi from the bear hug --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Ya -- ya -- ha -- Chief points his M-16 in the Iraqi's face.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Let him go. The Iraqi throws his hands in the air.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: No problem, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie shoves the Stern Iraqi into the room and goes to a series of wooden crates the size of file cabinets, where Chief helps Archie take off his backpack. Archie pulls out a bolt cutter and opens the crate, which is filled with hundreds of Kuwaiti passports.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: You look for the chemical weapon?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No. We look for the gold.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: Gold isn't here.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Shut the fuck up. They use the power tools to open the second crate -- also filled with hundreds of passports.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Where's the gold? The Friendly Iraqi looks at the Stern Iraqi. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: They move the gold. Archie pulls out the infrared map and shows it to the Stern Iraqi, who says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Kill him. They point their guns. It's a show. Archie holds the map.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: (points to map) This bunker in other village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four new Iraqi soldiers, armed with RIFLES, run from the far side of the square and start SHOOTING. Thirty rock-throwing Shiite scatter at the GUNFIRE. Two men fall to the ground as they are shot.

dialogues.speaker: WAILING CHILD
dialogues.text: Ma-maa! Vig looks terrified as the crowd scatters, leaving him alone as he points his big unloaded pistol. The soldiers point their rifles as they come towards Vig, when suddenly two of them look to the side and shout.

dialogues.speaker: TANKER ATTACK SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Stop the truck! PAN TO a metal tanker truck three hundred yards out, bearing down fast on the village square. The soldiers OPEN FIRE on the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The civilian riding shotgun FIRES back, as the WINDSHIELD SHATTERS on the truck. The driver is dead. The other civilian grabs the wheel.  47 48 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie bursts out the front door, followed by Troy and Chief. They freeze as -- The tanker truck careens sideways toward them, 50 feet away. An Iraqi soldier FIRES a GRENADE-LAUNCHER off his shoulder, which EXPLODES the container on the back of the truck. Milk explodes everywhere, cascading in a small wave over Archie and the others who have dived for cover. Civilian women with plastic containers and ceramic jugs rush out from alleys and try to scoop up the milk. A skinny dog laps it up. Other Shiites crowd the humvee and climb in. Iraqi soldiers drag the two bodies from the cab of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: point their guns in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Move. Out of the way. Archie shoves civilian peasants out of the humvee.

dialogues.speaker: PLEADING CIVILIAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: Hos-pital. She holds a shirtless boy of seven with a bandage around his entire chest. Chief pushes her off the humvee.

dialogues.speaker: PLEADING CIVILIAN MAN
dialogues.text: America help. He grabs Archie. Troy shoves the man off the vehicle. Vig STARTS the ENGINE.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Give them M.R.E.s. Troy rips open a large duffel and starts handing out Army meal rations and bottled water to the crowd. Iraqi soldiers rip the MREs from the civilians and step on them Vig leans on the HORN. The Friendly Iraqi jumps into the rear of the Hummer as it starts to pull away. Archie shoves the Friendly Iraqi out, and he lands on his ass in the swarm of chasing civilians. Archie and Troy look back the debacle as they pull away.  49 50 THREE KINGS - Rev. 12/16/98 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humvee is stopped in front of a rural cemetery. 50

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I'm all right, I'm cool. Right here, right now. I'm good. He lies down and breathes heavily with a hand on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: You'd think this would stop a guy. Sand nig -- I mean A-rab comes with his A.K. like so, I make my move, ‘Yo crawdaddy -- '

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on? The civilians are spitting on the soldiers, the soldiers are shooting civilians and ignoring us?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: They're after civilians now.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Why did they blow up that milk truck?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: To starve the people out.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Bush told the people to rise up against Saddam. They thought they'd have our support, they don't, and now they're getting slaughtered. The others, all drenched in sweat, take off their gas suits; their uniforms are underneath. They see two peasants closing the lid on a simple pine coffin, with a tie-died blanket covering the corpse inside.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Where's the next bunker? Archie is looking at the map, thinking. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 51 52 THREE KINGS - Rev. 12/16/98 40.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It's about 20 clicks on the map, according to what that guy said.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No it's not. PUSH IN TO Archie as he stares at the map, then thinks.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON the well at the village center -- see two men in traditional robes wearing an AK-47 beneath, PAN DOWN TO their military boots.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: The real bunker's at the well. In the center of town.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What town?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: The town we just came from. We went to the decoy bunker. That guy was lying, it's back where we came from.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I can't do this, okay? I've gota family and if I shit in a bag the rest of my life cuz I got shot after the war's already over that would be pretty fucking stupid, wouldn't it?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What is the most important thing in life?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What is it? The most important thing.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Money. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 THREE KINGS - Rev. 12/16/98 40A.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Money comes, money goes.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Respect.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Too dependent on other people.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: God's will.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Close.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Necessity.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: As in what?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: People do what is most necessary to them at any given moment. Right now it is most necessary for Saddam's troops to put down the uprising. As long as we don't interfere with that, we can do what we want. They won't touch us.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (to Chief) Does this feel right to you?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Yeah, it feels right. We're meant to go back there. Troy pauses.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Then I'll be wearing fashionable Kevlar.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Me, too! He pulls a vest out of the humvee. Vig does the same.  THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter drives the dune buggy through the fire-darkened skies closer to Kuwait. Oil fires dot the horizon. Paco the cameraman sits in back. Adriana Cruz sits in the sidecar.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Where the hell are the bunkers?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: They're supposed to be right around here, how about these fires?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: I_already did this story, goddamn it.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: How about a rare pelican migration out by the marshes?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: These brave pelicans are migrating in spite of massive pollution --

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Fuck that. Stop the fucking car.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's Chennowth, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dune buggy is stopped by the marsh. Ukrainian pelicans lie dead on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: I don't see any bunkers, do you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98 42.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: We'll find Major Gates, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Bullshit. All we're finding are Ukrainian cranes.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Pelicans.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: I already did this story. You're wasting my time. Look at these poor fucking birds all covered in some kind of fucking oil ecological disaster thing... (suddenly starts crying) «+. it's so goddamn horrible, Jesus, Jesus --

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (starts crying) Poor fucking birds. Look at them. It's so sad. It's so sad. I wish I never came here.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: (stops crying) You're not going to fuck me. He promised me the gold story and I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (still crying) Military regulations, you cannot drive. Adriana gets in the dune buggy. The cameraman sits on the back. Walter points his pistol at Cruz.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Get off the Chennowth, ma'am. Adriana STARTS the BUGGY.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Don't make me shoot you, ma'am. He does one of the defense moves we saw him practice earlier. The buggy pulls out, leaving him behind. He runs after her. She disappears. He stands there.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: 55 56 THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits there, distressed. The dune buggy drives back from the distance, circles him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: You gonna tell me where he is?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Get out the Chennowth, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ WALTER
dialogues.text: I don't need you if you I... I... I can't... don't tell me. You'll die fuck. Please stop, out here, just like these* please stop. fucking birds. You * worthless piece of shit. She leaves him again.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: She drives back, circles him.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Where is he? Where is he? Come on, bitch, where is he?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: It's some village near Karbala. She stops the dune buggy and he gets in.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: 56 Captain Van Meter stands self-consciously in front of a humvee.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: I'm walking, I'm walking, I'm talking, I'm talking, trying to look natural. I come over here and how about if I lean on it like this?

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: Would you ever stand like that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee  THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98 43A.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Let me see, I think I might. Jesus, this feels stupid.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: No, it's not stupid.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: I'm not really cut out for this, you know. There's three terrific young guys in my unit that you should really talk to.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: This one kid, Barlow, actually shot somebody yesterday which was a pretty big deal for us.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: That's not what we want.

dialogues.speaker: CATCH DAITCH
dialogues.text: This is why the captain's story is never told. Captains have no patience to talk about themselves.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: It's true the captain's story is never told.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: So let's do it, mister. Let's tell that captain's story. I've got all morning.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Faster. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bach's "GLORIA" plays LOUD as Vig drives and Archie stares straight ahead as the humvee picks up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hummer zips back into the same village square. A few peasants try to scoop milk from the blown-open milk truck and a soldier pushes them away. Children run around frenetically. A few bodies lie piled on the ground. Two soldiers stand around watching over everything, which has calmed down somewhat. The humvee pulls up to the village well, where the two disguised soldiers stand.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: (into megaphone) United States Military. Put your weapons down. Troy and Chief leap out, hold rifles at arm's length as they accost the two soldiers disguised as peasants.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Put it down. Troy and Chief shove the two disguised soldiers face down in the dirt, pull up their robes, take their weapons, and cuff their hands. The three Iraqi soldiers from the milk area jog over. Troy and Chief disarm these three soldiers and remove the clips. Vig holds the mounted machine gun on all of them.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Don't make me smoke your ass, Abdul. We gonna have no nonsense this time. Archie pulls up a metal bunker door inside the well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie runs down a narrow cement corridor, pistol held at arm's length, white document in the other hand; followed by Troy and Chief. The Stern Iraqi soldier steps into the corridor at the far end, sees Archie coming, looks terrified, and runs back. Archie and Troy run right past the scared Iraqi. Chief comes third, slamming the Stern Iraqi face down and cuffing him. Archie kicks a door open and goes in, followed by Troy.  60 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie and Troy burst in, pointing their weapons aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Freeze. A large room; walls lined with shelves full of brand-new appliances: blenders, Cuisinarts, CD players, small TVs. A huge portrait of Saddam Hussein covers one wall. A TELEVISION plays a rerun of "Happy Days" in Arabic. Another TV: CNN's first reports of the Rodney King beating. An IRAQI CAPTAIN sits in a chair in front of the TVs. TWO IRAQIS sit, loading rifles. Two OTHERS sit at a RADIO. One tries to figure out a Stairmaster flashing German. They all jump to their feet when Archie bursts in, except for the Captain watching "Happy Days" and CNN.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: By order of the cease-fire signed in Safwan, March third, the United States Military hereby confiscates all material stolen by Iraq from the State of Kuwait -- One of the rifle-loading Iraqis tries to run. Troy heads him off with his rifle --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Down. The other Rifle-Loader stands, looking scared.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Please don't hurt me, I surrender. WHIP PAN TO Chief, who turns the shortwave RADIO OFF, pushes the two Iraqis to the ground. One goes peacefully, the other resists; Chief smacks him in the side of the head with his RIFLE, which FIRES accidentally. Everyone grabs their heads and ducks -- except Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Keep your goddamn finger off the trigger, Chief. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. Archie is offered a Cuisinart by the Iraqi Captain.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: For wife.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I'm divorced. He throws it on the floor and disarms the Captain. Troy has one Rifle Iraqi on the ground, but the second is on his knees, putting a CD into a mini-stereo.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: Newest and best.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No, newest and best has better noise reduction. The Iraqi looks puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Less distortion. Get down on the floor, okay? He pushes the man face down, cuffs his hands. OLIVIA NEWTON-JOHN's "I Wanna Get Physical" plays.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: This is bad music, it's bad for you.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey -- WHIP PAN TO the resistant Iraqi struggling to break away; Chief punches him in the head twice; the Iraqi starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: (to Iraqi Captain) Where's the gold? Tell us so we don't have to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: There's another room over here. PAN TO Troy, pointing to a narrow door in a corner of the room. Archie kicks it open.  61 62 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bound, half-naked MAN IN GLASSES, clean-shaven, lies on a metal bed frame. There is an electric cable going to the bed frame. The Man in Glasses shakes. Troy watches Archie walk over and yank the cable out.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: I am just do my job, buddy. Archie pauses, then gives the Sergeant a backhand that sends him flying to the corner. Archie steps on the man's wrist, takes a pistol out of his hand. Troy watches. Archie turns and sees nine civilians across the room: A pair of twin brothers in Western clothing, a woman in Western clothing, two women in traditional robes, and four children. The men and women are bound and gagged. Archie steps toward the civilians, but the interrogator, SA'ID, 35, also a captain, steps in his way.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: These rebel Iraq problem. United States is out now. Archie stares at Sa'id with contempt.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: We take them outside, so it don't bother you, okay, sir? (in Arabic) Take them out. The disarmed Iraqi Sergeant nods and opens a small rear door and pushes the rebel civilians out. Archie walks back to the main room and points his pistol in Sa'id's face.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Take us to the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig keeps the five cuffed Iraqi guards on the ground at gunpoint as 15 Shiites with crude clubs and slingshots encircle.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: America! We beat Saddam now! One of the civilians shoots a rock from the slingshot and nails a handcuffed Iraqi in the back of the head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Don't start this shit again. The civilians and Iraqi soldiers back away as Vig mans th mounted humvee machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I know y'all Shiite gettin' yer ass whipped -- hey, what the hell is going on here? PAN TO the nine civilians, and the naked Man with Glasses who is getting dressed, exiting the bunker, ushered by the unarmed Iraqi Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Git on the fucking ground, Arab.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: Prisoner stay. (in Arabic) Don't you move.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about? Suddenly, an Iraqi woman runs up to the tortured Man with Glasses and embraces him, sobbing. A little girl with dirty casts on both broken arms runs up and hugs his legs. The bound civilians prisoners start to walk away from the bunker as someone cuts their ropes, and the unarmed Sergeant has a fit.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Prisoners stay, don't move! He and two other unarmed Iraqi soldiers chase the prisoners, push them back. The free civilians shoot rocks and club them. A cuffed guard tries to fight back. Vig swings toward him.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, everybody, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie runs down several narrow sets of cement stairs, followed by Sa'id, the other Iraqi Captain, Troy, and Chief. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: (subtitled; Arabic) It's my ass, donkey dick, Saddam will shoot me dead.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: (subtitled; Arabic) Saddam worries more about the rebels than the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The civilian crowd is beating on the unarmed Iraqi soldiers who try to defend themselves; the Iraqi Sergeant is holding on to the Man in Glasses while the woman beats on him; the little girl is shouting. Suddenly an Iraqi armored truck with a mounted machine gun races up and seven Republican guards pour out swinging clubs, followed by an Iraqi major, about 45. The Iraqi soldiers savagely beat the civilians. Vig looks horrified as he watches. Two soldiers grab the woman from the Sergeant holding the Man in Glasses, the little girl chases her.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: This is the United States Military. The Iraqi major looks Vig over, then looks back to his soldiers as they round up eight civilians and make them lay face down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Chief disarm two guards outside a door in the basement. Archie goes through the door, followed by Sa'id and the other Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright white cement, many overhead lights and a high ceiling. Empty but for 15 brand new, jumbo-sized Louis Vuitton suitcases standing neatly in a row in the center of the room. Archie stands looking at the suitcases with Troy and Chief. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Several of the big Vuitton suitcases are laid on their sides by Archie, Troy and Chief. The Iraqi Captain paces frantically, punching and kicking the walls and talking.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: (subtitled; Arabic) It's Saddam's gold.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: (subtitled; Arabic) Shut up, he signed the treaty. The suitcases are quickly unzipped. One suitcase is full of gleaming antique silverware. One suitcase is full of jewelry. Archie opens one full of hundreds of gold Cartier watches. Troy and Chief slip a handful of jewelry into their pockets. The Iraqi Captain goes nuts, throwing himself on Chief's back, choking Chief, who flails about. Troy punches the Iraqi in the head and rips him off Chief. Archie puts his pistol in the man's face.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Listen to me: we leave you alone to beat up your people, but everything you took from Kuwait belongs to us now, understand? He turns to Chief.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Put it back.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Stick to the plan. The plan is for gold and we're not thieves, we're recovering Kuwait's gold, correct? Chief and Troy, out of breath, empty their pockets of jewelry. Archie opens another Vuitton suitcase and pushes it aside -- it's full of Kuwaiti passports. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 51.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: When Chief opens the next suitcase, he freezes. Archie looks over and freezes. Troy closes cuffs behind the captain's back and looks over his shoulder -- wide-eyed. The very large Vuitton suitcase is filled with ten-kilo bricks of gold. They all stare. Troy picks one up.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Is this five kilos? Archie holds another brick.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: That's ten kilos.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Five, six, seven, eight, there's thirty bricks in this suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Times 100K each --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Three million dollars. Archie opens another large Vuitton suitcase, and it is also filled with thirty bars. Troy opens another suitcase, there's another thirty bars. Chief opens another, another thirty bars. They frantically check all of the suitcases. The handcuffed captain is crying.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Ten suitcases; sixty bricks each. That's thirty million dollars. Archie, Chief, and Troy look at each other in shock.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: How do we get it out of here?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Let's see what we're dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF AND TROY
dialogues.text: struggle with Archie to pick up the heavy, jumbo-sized suitcases sideways, like a table top.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get a fleet of Lexus convertibles in different colors. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 67 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 52.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I told you Lexus doesn't make a convertible.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'll bet you a Lexus they do.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: You're on for a Lexus, but it won't be a convertible. Suddenly the suitcase rips apart and gold bars fall to the floor; one lands on Troy's foot. He jumps in pain.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Shit. Archie, Troy and Chief hoist another suitcase sideways and the bricks rip through and fall to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: They didn't get it here in these bags. The tensilary strength goes only to 200 pounds.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Tensilary strength, it's what the suitcase can hold.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Why would you know a word like that?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: He works at an airport.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: 30 bars, 27 pounds each is like 900 pounds. The smaller Vuittons handle 65, maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You got any more luggage here? Sa'id looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 120 small, round and square Vuitton overnight bags, laid out and opened, cover the entire floor of the basement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 53.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Troy and Chief finish putting two and three bars in each bag.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: We can't move all this.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I saw a truck by the gas station.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What's the shipping plan, sir?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I told you that's handled.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: We're in it now, I want to know the plan.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: We gotta know how we're getting this home.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: My friend Teebaux is French Special Forces.

dialogues.speaker: 67A FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON Teebaux's face as he bathes.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He's gonna put it in barrels filled with oil and bury it. In a few weeks, we'll drive it to Yanbu --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Where's Yanbu?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: It's a port in Saudi.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where another friend will ship it on a Turkish boat up in the Red Sea to Marsielles, where a French boat will take it to Baltimore -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 68 69 70 71 72 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 53A.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Get the truck.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: All right, let's see what U-Haul has on the lot today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy runs up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy runs out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Conrad, we need a truck -- Troy stops and stares: he sees the Soldiers have mostly subdued the civilian crowd, they have many people on the ground, some of them shouting. The Woman is pleading, the LITTLE GIRL stands with her. The man in glasses, is still gagged, and is subdued aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR'S WIFE
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Let my husband go, you held him too long, please, please.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Did you get it, hoo-a?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (distracted monotone) Hoo-a, we got it.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Is it a lot?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (distracted monotone) Hoo-aaaaa. Are you cool here?

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: They've been ignoring me, but hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy runs across the square to a turquoise truck.  THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 53B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy STARTS the TRUCK, drives back toward the well.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (under his breath) ‘Little deuce coupe with a flat head mill, she'll walk a Thunderbird like it's standin' still -- She'll do a hundred and forty with the top end floored --'  74 75 76 77 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twin brothers in Western clothing are being mocked by soldiers; jumping back as they are taunted. Troy parks the turquoise truck close to the bunker, upset by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: ‘She's my little deuce coupe --'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie, Chief, Sa'id run up carrying Vuitton cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hurry past the huge poster of Saddam, the TVS PLAYING "Happy Days" and Rodney King, the many shelves of stereos, etc., and past the soldiers lying face down, handcuffed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie, Chief, and Sa'id charge out of the bunker with Vuitton luggage and put it onto the truck. Archie and Chief survey the scene: Iraqi soldiers, who have been mocking the Twins in Western clothing, are laughing. Many civilians are subdued on the ground, some bleeding. A cuffed Iraqi guard kneels with a bleeding head. Troy looks at Archie and Chief. The Iraqi Major greets Sa'id warmly and they embrace.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) My brother, how are you? These Americans are here to take back the gold.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) No problem. Then the Major salutes Archie.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: You take the Kuwaiti gold, yes?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We take the Kuwaiti gold, yes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: Saddam cannot keep.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No, Saddam cannot keep.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: Saddam have too many problem today. A rebel runs past, throws a rock, is tackled by a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: He certainly does.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: You need help to load?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I think we're all right.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Come over here, help him. Two soldiers jog over, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: These man help you.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: You go way fast from this bullshit. Archie looks at one soldier's hands: blood on the knuckles, PAN UP TO their faces.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Let's load up and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers carry bags up the stairs. A chain of four Iraqi soldiers and Troy, Chief, Vig pass luggage into the truck. Archie mans the mounted gun and watches. Captive civilians and Iraqi soldiers watch.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Lay that one flat; okay, sideways -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 79 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 56.
