dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The truck is completely full (including the passenger seat). They are finished, and very sweaty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy gets in the truck, slams the door. Chief and Vig are in the humvee. Archie sits in the humvee's driver seat, slams the door. He looks at the IRAQI WOMAN, far to the side who is being restrained and shouting in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR'S WIFE
dialogues.text: (to Americans, in Arabic) Do not go. They will kill my husband. The girl in arm casts is screaming and punching the legs the soldiers restraining her mother. The sergeant and another soldier pull the Iraqi woman away, stand her in an open area, and SHOOT her dead. Troy jerks in his seat and turns away. Archie bows his head to the steering wheel. Chief looks down. Vig stares wide-eyed. The girl in arm casts screams, is grabbed by the hair and pulled away. The man in glasses screams, grabs his daughter, is thrown down and menaced with a knife. Archie gets out of the humvee and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: This has to stop.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: You go now, please. He salutes Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: That man leader of uprising.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Archie, let's stick to the plan, sir, the plan is for gold, right?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: We can help them, then be on our way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 80 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 57.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No, we can't. It's not what we're here for.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Cover me. Troy gets out of the truck, Chief gets out of the humvee, and they nervously point their rifles at Iraqi soldiers who point their guns back. Vig jumps to his feet and mans the 60 mm as Archie walks over to the Iraqi soldier menacing the man in glasses with a knife.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No unnecessary shots, Conrad, cuz we know what they do.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Make infected pockets filled with bile, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: That's right, that's what they do. They watch with trepidation as Archie grabs the Iraqi soldier's wrist, pulling the blade away. The soldier grabs for Archie's throat with his free hand, but Archie grabs this hand, twists it away, puts the Iraqi ina choke hold, drops the soldier to the dirt. The man in glasses, clutching his daughter, runs to the body of his dead wife and weeps while his daughter prays.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR'S DAUGHTER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Allah watch over my mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie walks back to the Iraqi Major by the humvee.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I want you to leave this town.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Saddam kill us if we leave. Kill our family.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: (to Major) Take all your soldiers and get out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 81 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 58.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Troy, Chief, Vig point their guns. The Iraqi Major is pissed.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD MAJOR
dialogues.text: We give you the gold, now U.S.A. is out of civil war. The Iraqi Major raises his machine gun as he stands next to the humvee, but Archie grabs the barrel and holds it down.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No shooting.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, we work something out. The Major smashes the barrel of his machine gun, with Archie's hand, against the humvee. Archie winces, but doesn't let go. Instead, the Major does it again, smashing Archie's hand. Archie winces, doesn't let go. The Major tries to jerk the barrel up, but Archie pushes it down, and it FIRES by accident, into the Major's leg. The Major howls with pain. Blood dribbles out of the bottom of his pant leg like piss. Troy covers Iraqi #4 with his rifle, cannot see Archie.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Accident. Stay cool. Vig nervously swings the mounted machine gun from one Iraqi in the rear to another, but doesn't shoot. Iraqi soldiers point their rifles at the Americans.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No. WHIP PAN TO Iraqi #4: jerks his RIFLE toward Archie and FIRES. The SOUND CUTS OUT. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 82 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION: WHIP PAN FROM Iraqi rifle to Archie. The only sound is the BULLET PIERCING the FLESH of Archie's lower left arm and tearing his muscle as it passes through. Archie grimaces violently in pain. SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION: Troy fires his pistol. NO SOUND EXCEPT for the SLOW MOTION sound of the BULLET EXPLODING. SLOW MOTION: The bullet tears through Iraqi #4's chest. The only sound is the Iraqi's HEARTBEAT, the BULLET TEARING FLESH and CRUSHING BONE, and the HEARTBEAT STOPPING with a violent SPLASH. Iraqi #4 falls to the ground with only a dull thud and the slow clank of his gear. REGULAR SPEED: Vig swings the mounted machine gun from one Iraqi to another, but still doesn't shoot. He looks terrified as his finger twitches on the trigger. Iraqi #2 FIRES a PISTOL TWICE. SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION: A BULLET tears into Troy's chest with a dull SNAP. He winces in pain. PAN TO Chief as he FIRES his RIFLE. PAN TO -- SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION; no sound except the BULLE TEARING into Iraqi #2's knee, smashing through bone. He falls to the ground clutching his leg. SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION: Vig swings the mounted MACHINE GUN and FIRES. No sound but the slow CRACKS of the red tracer BULLETS EXPLODING from the GUN. SLOW MOTION: Tracer bullets slice across the face of Iraqi #3 and the Iraqi Sergeant in the rear; no sound but the BULLETS BREAKING through BONE and FLESH. SLOW MOTION: Archie jams his PISTOL under the Major's chin and FIRES -- the only sound is the slow EXPLOSION of the GUN, and the slow TEARING of TISSUE, ending with a sharp SNAP as the tissue, bone and the bullet crack out the top of the Iraqi Major's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE LOOKING DOWN -- REPLAY of entire shootout at REGULAR SPEED. Ending on the wide-eyed Little Girl with her hand in her mouth, staring.  83 84 85 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER ANGLE -- REPLAY of entire shootout at REGULAR SPEED. Ending on Troy wincing as he holds his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead Iraqi Major lies face down in sand with eyes 85 open; Sa'id holds his hand and weeps. Archie's lightly blood-flecked face stares down at the dead Major, clouds pass overhead. Dead Iraqi #4 lies with legs twisted under his body. A rivulet of blood trickles through the sand. A spider runs across it and gets stuck.

dialogues.speaker: UP AT CHIEF
dialogues.text: Stone still, staring straight ahead as clouds pass slowly above him in the sky. Vig nervously swings the mounted machine gun back and forth. Troy, drenched in sweat, looks pained as he unbuttons his shirt: there's a gunshot in his Kevlar vest. The slug drops out of the dent, into his hand -- he exhales. Iraqis #5, #6, #7 and the Sergeant, throw their hands up in surrender and drop their weapons. Archie points.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Cover these three. Vig swings the mounted machine gun toward the three remaining Iraqi soldiers who stand over eight terrified civilians.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Chief. Chief follows Archie over to the three Iraqi soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Down. The soldiers get on their knees, pleading for mercy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 85 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 61.

dialogues.speaker: T.C. REP. GUARD
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Please don't kill me. Chief takes the Iraqi soldiers' guns and pushes them down.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Put the people in the humvee.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: There's no room.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Make room.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What happened to the plan?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: It just changed.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Not for me, let's go. Chief points to the civilians.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: What if that was you? Troy displays the gunshot in the Kevlar.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What if this was you not wearing Kevlar? Civilians and Iraqi soldiers watch the debate nervously. Suddenly, the sound of an APPROACHING TANK. They turn. A tank rolls toward them fast, down a narrow side street, followed by a truck.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Great, a fucking tank. That should send us on our way.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: L.A.W., sir. Vig lifts the L.A.W. rocket, extends the tube. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 62.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No. Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It's about fucking time. Troy jumps into the luggage-packed truck, STARTS the ENGINE. Vig starts the humvee; Archie jumps in next to Vig. PAN TO the eight civilians -- the twin brothers, the woman in Western clothing, the traditional woman and her two kids, plus the Man In Glasses and the Little Girl, jam into the crowded humvee. Chief jumps in. The tank approaches. The humvee pulls away. The tank rolls in from the side.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: (subtitled; Arabic) The Americans cannot save you. They are leaving the Gulf. Give up. The TANK TURRET WHINES and CLICKS, stuck in place. An Iraqi pops out the top of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: TANK TURRET IRAQI
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Push it, come on. He gestures to the WHINING, stuck TURRET. Another Iraqi tries pushing the turret. The truck pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it bounces along fast. Archie is in pain while Chief pours disinfectant over the flesh wound in Archie's lower left arm, and wraps it. Vig looks terrified as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy, driving alone, speeds the truck as fast as it will go, bouncing along the road.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: We were home free, you stupid son of a bitch.  88 89 90 91 92 93 94 95 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck is 60 yards behind the humvee.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What's the tank doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH JIGGLING BINOCULARS of the tank turning.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lining us up --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Vig pushes the humvee's accelerator to the floor. The civilian Man In Glasses and his Little Girl cling to the humvee with six other civilians, including two five-year-olds, a boy and girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Iraqi soldiers set up a mortar and load it with a round. A GUNSHOT RINGS OUT, a soldier is hit in the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHIP PAN TO a civilian boy with an old rifle behind the decorative roof of a building. Iraqis shout and point at the sniper. The tank turns to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TANK FIRES and blows away a section of decorative roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Iraqi soldiers FIRE a MORTAR toward the humvee, half a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig turns the speeding humvee off the road. Archie jerks the wheel back.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Stay on the road.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I_don't wanna get hit. SLOW MOTION: Chief looks straight up with the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: DAY 97
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: A mortar streaks across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REAR OF HUMVEE, SLOW MOTION: Half the civilians hunch down, bracing for an explosion while the other half crane their necks, looking straight up into the sky. They cower when there is an EXPLOSION above. REGULAR SPEED: PAN UP TO the MORTAR as it EXPLODES in the sky a hundred yards above the humvee -- into a yellow/white cloud.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iraqis FIRE TWO more gas MORTARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy leans out the window of the moving truck and squints up at the white/yellow gas cloud above as he drives fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie and Chief grapple to put on their gas masks. Vig reaches around behind him for his mask as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Where's my mask?  102 103 104 105 106 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He accidentally veers off the road into the open desert. ZOOM IN TO a field of mines sitting right on top of the sand, 20 yards ahead. (Iraqi mines were often placed this way.) ZOOM IN ON Archie's alarmed face.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Mine. Archie grabs the woman in Western clothing and dives from the humvee followed by Vig, Chief, the Man In Glasses holding the Little Girl, the other civilians, including t two five-year-olds. The Hummer drives ten yards, hits the first MINE with an EXPLOSION and flies into the air --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying DEBRIS SMASHES the WINDSHIELD. Troy instinctively jerks the wheel and the truck flips onto its side and slides across the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The airborne humvee lands on its side, hits another MINE, is BLOWN into the air, lands on its back, is BLOWN to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy sits sideways as the truck slides across the sand to a halt inches before a mine, 30 yards behind the wrecked humvee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. A WHEEL on the wrecked humvee spins in the air, SQUEAKING. Louis Vuitton suitcases are scattered all over. One has opened and the gold bars are spilled around. Vig's right eye has taken shrapnel and is a bloody mess -- he gropes in the sand as blood drips down.  108 107 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief pulls a syringe from a sterile packet, is about to stick it into his leg when Archie grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: This isn't sarin. We'd be dead by now.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Is it mustard?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No, it's C.S.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Tear-gas?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Tear gas times ten. Where's Barlow?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I can't even see the truck. Archie puts his gas mask on the little girl with arm casts. Chief takes his mask off when he sees what Archie has done and gives it to the civilian Man in Glasses. Civilians stagger to their feet, some cut and bleeding, some limping. They cover their faces with their clothes as the dense white/yellow fog descends around them. Chief picks up Vig, who stands, blinking his one good eye, while blood streams down his face. He sees his big pistol in the sand with some loose shells, picks them up and puts them in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Cover your face, Conrad. Cover your mouth, man.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Where's Troy? Vig is in shock. Chief lifts Vig's bloody hand to Vig's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unseen in the fog, Troy climbs out of the overturned truck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He picks up two Vuitton hat cases, looks up, sees the two little children from the humvee, running across a mine- field screaming.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Hey. Stop. Troy stands watching as the children run farther away, crying.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. He runs, hard, after the children, who are now 70 yards away, the Vuitton hat cases banging against his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy chases the children through the white/yellow fog, eyes tearing. He drops one of the suitcases, catches up to the girl and scoops her up in his left arm and covers her face with her coat. Troy runs between land mines after the boy, who is way ahead. Troy drops the other Vuitton bag, catches the boy and has both children under his arms like footballs -- when suddenly Troy is grabbed from behind with a cord around his neck -- he lands on his back with the two children in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sa'id, wearing a gas mask, kicks Troy in the head. The screaming children are torn from Troy's arms by Iraqi soldiers. Troy reaches for his knife and it is ripped from his hand as he is dragged to an Iraqi truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru 112 Archie and Chief circle through the thick haze, each carrying a Vuitton hat case and cover their mouths and noses, choking and coughing. About five civilians wander around, confused.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Look out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 112 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 67A. CONTINUED: (Al) 112 Archie spins around, drops the bag and points his pistol. Two black-robed figures wearing Russian gas masks pick up Vuitton hat cases.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Don't move. A black-robed figure walks right past Archie, carrying a Vuitton bag, and takes one of the scared twin men by the arm and leads him to the side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: More black-cloaked figures appear. There are thirty in all, wearing Russian masks. Archie, Chief and Vig look disoriented, as Archie points his pistol around as black robes grab suitcases and lead the civilians away.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The robes lead the civilians to a four-foot-high tunnel entrance in a mound of desert earth and disappear into it. Vig stands and rubs his one good eye, coughing. Chief grabs Vig by the arm and pulls him back toward the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Get in the tunnel. vig jerks his arm away.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Troy. Chief grabs Vig.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: You're gonna die. Vig punches Chief in the side of the head. Chief punches Vig in the stomach. They fall to the ground, fighting. Archie searches for Troy in the white/yellow haze.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Barlow. Two black-robed figures pull Vig off Chief and drag him to the tunnel. Another robed figure pulls Chief to the tunnel. Archie walks, looks for Troy, chokes, vomits into the sand. A black-robed figure takes him by the arm and pulls him back to the tunnel, where they disappear inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. People choking and vomiting (six civilians, Archie Chief, Vig). Gas lanterns swing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 116 117 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 69.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The tunnel is six feet tall. Buckets are passed, filled with oiled rags that people use to wipe their faces. Archie takes a dripping rag and wipes his eyes, nose, mouth.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: We have to go back. We can't leave him there. Vig's mutilated right eye is bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We have to wait until it clears.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: You_made the choice and we lost Troy --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I had no choice.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: You_had a choice.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I_had no fucking choice. Vig starts crying. Chief hands a bandage to Archie, who puts it over Vig's wounded eye socket.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: What about Troy? What choice does he have now? PAN ACROSS the Man In Glasses as he wipes his daughter's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Republican Guards strip Troy's clothes as he stands in fr of Oasis Bunker. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 118 THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Other soldiers pull off gas masks; one is Sa'id. An Iraqi tank is parked to the side. Small numbers of Republican Guards and civilians mill about.

dialogues.speaker: REPUBLICAN GUARD
dialogues.text: (subtitled; Arabic) Can we shoot him?

dialogues.speaker: REPUBLICAN GUARD
dialogues.text: (subtitled; Arabic) We're not supposed to hold any Americans.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: (subtitled; Arabic) He's proof they broke the cease- fire. A GUN SHOT RINGS OUT. The Iraqis turn to look.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) They're taking the tank. PAN TO seven civilians with rifles as they climb the unmanned Iraqi tank. Four Republican Guards FIRE back at the civilians. Troy, in his shorts, tries to break away in the chaos. He runs for it, past a fence, is tackled and dragged toward the bunker, sand all over his face -- He sees Adriana Cruz drive up on the far side of the tank.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (screams ) Hey, Walter. Hey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adriana Cruz drives the dune buggy up and stops -- they cannot hear Troy over the TANK and DUNE BUGGY'S ENGINES and commotion.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Start shooting, Paco.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I don't like this, we gotta go -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (screams ) Hey, Walter, Walter. They don't hear him. Troy is dragged into the bunker. Republican Guards pull Walter and Adriana off the dune buggy.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Let_me handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy is led, naked, down the corridor by two soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civilian rebels sit on top of the captured tank with RIFLES as it drives toward the bunker. Republic Guards FIRE on them, but the TURRET aims at the bunker and FIRES -- BLASTING a hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy is thrown onto the floor of a cluttered cement bathroom with two crude toilets. His clothes are thrown on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: REPUBLICAN GUARD
dialogues.text: Get dress.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: REPUBLICAN GUARD
dialogues.text: Get dress.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I_said okay. The door is slammed. Stolen blenders, radios, CDs, stacks of new Levis litter the floor. Troy kicks all the crap angrily and dozens of cell phones tumble from a box. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Troy looks at the pile of cell phones, picks one up, tries it for a dial tone, drops it, tries another, until he gets one that gives him a tone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Can I help you? Troy looks stunned.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (into the cell phone) Um. Do you speak English?

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (British accent) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (into cell phone) Can you -- I need -- He frantically pushes stuff on the floor to block the door.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What number, please?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Operation Desert Storm.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: The big army in the desert, come on, it's an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: OPERATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don't have that number.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Maybe you could -- hello? The phone is dead.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Fuck. He throws it to the ground, tries another, no dial tone, throws it, tries another, no dial tone, throws it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, come on. He tries another, chucks it, another, gets a DIAL TONE, dials, and waits while the PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: BUNKER
dialogues.text: DEBBIE, Troy's wife, picks up the RINGING TELEPHONE and has been woken up. She has a CRYING BABY on her arm.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: (Southern accent) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Honey, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Troy?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It's me, honey.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: My God, the baby's crying.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I can hear her.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: That's our little Krystal.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: How's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: She hasn't been sleeping good, and my mother had to go back to work, so I'm real tired, baby.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I wish I was there to help, gooney-bird.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Oh, gooney-bird, when are you coming home?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm working on that right now, baby. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I saw an ad for a computer job. You want me to call and set up an interview?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Listen, honey --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What date are you coming home?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: They haven't given us an exact date yet. Listen --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I'm henpecking you.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No, you're not.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I'm lonely and tired and most of all, I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I miss you, too. FIRE and CONCRETE EXPLODE into one wall of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: The wall just exploded.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: I thought the war was over, honey.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It is and it isn't, babe. Can you do me a favor and call the reserve center?

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: You want me to call the reserve center?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Tell the duty N.C.O. I'm stuck in a bunker near 223 north outside Karbala -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean 'stuck'? I thought the war was over.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be fine, honey, I don't want you to worry, I tried to do something for the family, and I want you to know --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Know what? A TANK ROUND SMASHES through the wall, covers Troy in dust.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: That I love you.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What's happening, Troy?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Tell Krystal -- Republic Guards push at the door, trying to open it.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Troy?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Tell Krystal I'm a rich man and if things work out she'll be taken care of no matter what --

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? The door is kicked open and Republican Guards enter.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Gotta go, gooney-bird, I love you -- Republic Guards 1 & 2 punch Troy in the face, drag him fr the room.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Troy? She waits for a moment, tears in her eyes, and hangs up.  123 124 thru 125 THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TANK ROUND rocks the room; soldiers frantically exit. CNN is left PLAYING in the empty room with Adriana Cruz's report from the previous day. "I JUST WANT TO CELEBRATE" plays:

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Spirits are high and the music is soaring as these young troops celebrate --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru 125 Republican Guards SHOOT rebels off the tank and re-take it. PULL BACK TO Adriana Cruz and Paco, the cameraman.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: (crying) Look at these fucking people shooting these kids, for Christ's fucking sake, fuck it, fuck it, fuck it. (stops crying) I'm being held captive by Iraqi troops at a bunker far outside the gritty city of Karbala, where Shiite --

dialogues.speaker: PACO
dialogues.text: You said gritty city again.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: (screams, crying) Who fucking gives a shit these people are dying, you asshole.

dialogues.speaker: PACO
dialogues.text: What about Private Wogoman, Adriana?

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Let's lay a few of these down first. In three, two, and, I'm being held captive in a gritty area outside Karbala, where Shiites and others are rising up -- PAN TO Walter stripped naked by Republic Guards. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: REPUBLICAN GUARD LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) I don't want the reporter to see this.

dialogues.speaker: REPUBLICAN GUARD SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Hey, that's the N.B.S. woman.

dialogues.speaker: REPUBLICAN GUARD SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Wow. She's much taller in person.

dialogues.speaker: REPUBLICAN GUARD LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Get them out of here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter sits in the Chennowth, naked. Adriana Cruz in the passenger seat, Paco in the back. Republican guards pull the tape out. She grabs it back.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: That's mine.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Could I have my pants, please? They hand him his socks.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Pants. On my legs. They give him his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: What did you want to be as a boy?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: I think I wanted to be either a veterinarian or a C.I.A. sharp shooter.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Doug?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Yes, Colonel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: I'm giving an interview to C.B.S.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Do you have authorization? Van Meter pulls out a paper and hands it over.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: (looks at paper) No.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Who gave you this?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Major Gates.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Archie Gates gave you this? Jesus Christ, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: I don't get to do the interview.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: No, you don't get to do the interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie, Chief, Vig, and dozens of civilians crouch as the walk through the tunnel, single file, carrying Vuitton bags.

dialogues.speaker: SAME SCENE
dialogues.text: They are still walking in the long tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 129
dialogues.text: 130 131 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a cavernous room. A line of ten children with missing limbs and bandages stand and watch Archie, Chief and Vig enter. They make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: HANDS OF SA'ID
dialogues.text: carefully wrap a bare wire around Troy's right ear.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: (heavy accent) What is your rank, bro?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Your company?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: 437th Civil Affairs Company, U.S. Army Reserve. The wire is wrapped under Troy's chin around his other ear.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: My main man. Tell me something, okay? What is problem with Michael Jackson?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: The King of Pop. Woo-hoo.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Yeah, Michael Jackson.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: He come to Egypt. I see picture in newspaper. Hello with the white glove. I am King of Pop in my hotel with my chopped-up face. Troy looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Your country make him chop up his face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 80.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Michael Jackson is Pop King of sick fahking country.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Troy is smashed in the face with a clipboard. He looks angry, and like he could cry at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: You are the blind bullshit, my main man. It is so obvious the black man make his skin white and the hair straight -- you know why?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Your sick fahking country make the black man hate hisself, just like you hate the Arab and the children you bomb over here.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I don't hate children. (pause) This is illegal, you know. The war's over.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Yeah, the war is over, that's why you are illegal, man. You break the cease-fire, I think maybe even you steal the gold, so nobody know where you are, right? Your army don't know. I send to you Baghdad for a long time. Nobody find you. Troy looks scared.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: They'll find me. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 81.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Do they care, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Does who care?

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Do your army care about the children in Iraq? Do they come back to help?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No, they're not coming. Sa'id signals someone 0.S. Troy turns to look, scared.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Get it ready. O.B. #3 Interrogation Guard #1 gestures at a console that is connected to the wire around Troy's jaw. O.B. #3 Interrogation Guard #2 reaches forward and turns a dial. Interrogation Guard #1 murmurs defensively and turns the dial back.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Just get it ready. (in Arabic) Come on. They touch a loose wire to metal rod, it sparks. They connect it to Troy's wire. Sa'id turns back to Troy.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Are they coming to help the Shiite?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Tell the truth, dudesky. Save us the big bummer.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: That's the truth. Sa'id signals the guards -- Troy braces. The guard turns a dial, voltage races through the wire, and Troy's face contorts with pain, his teeth chip as he gnashes them together, he bites his lip. Troy starts shaking slightly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 131 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 82.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Does it hurt? Troy says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: I ask you question, man.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Yes, it hurts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: You bomb my family. Do you know that? You blow up my home. The whole street. My wife is crush by big fahking block of concrete. She lose her legs, bro, and she got nice legs, too. Those legs cut off now. Emotion comes into Sa'id's voice as he says this. The other

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (whispers) That's horrible.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (whispers) I said, that's horrible.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Oh, my God, buddy. I didn't even told you the horrible part yet. two guards listen sadly.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: My son was kill in his bed. Did you heard that, dude?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: He is one years old. He is asleeping with his toy doll when the bomb come. You see that guy over there? He lose his daughter same way: big U.S.A. bomb.

dialogues.speaker: TWO GUARDS
dialogues.text: one of them wipes away a tear.

dialogues.speaker: BEDROOM 132
dialogues.text: Concrete and plaster falls onto the bed of a sleeping child. END OF FANTASY.  84.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I have a daughter.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Very nice for you, bro. She is safe in Ohio without the bombs and concrete and all this shit --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm not from Ohio.

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY
dialogues.text: Debbie pushes a baby carriage down an idyllic tree-lined sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How old is she?

dialogues.speaker: TROY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ten days old.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What's her name? END OF FANTASY.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Krystal.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: What makes you decide to tell me about Krystal, my main man?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Because we're both fathers.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: I'm not a father no more, dude, remember? My son is dead now. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Can you think how it feels inside your heart if I bomb your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY
dialogues.text: A BOMB BLOWS in a window on Debbie and the baby.  137 138 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dozen people are laying down, being treated by BLACK ROBES and the woman in Western clothing, who squeeze aloe onto facial blisters. At the end of the hall, Archie grits his teeth in pain as a Black Robe uses a turkey baster to shoot alcohol into h infected wound. Chief prays next to some praying civilians; he has white ointment on his face. A Black Robe changes Vig's bloody bandage, while a dead body is laid next to Vig and wrapped in cloths; two Black Robes chant.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Is that guy dead? Where you gonna put him? Is that guy dead? Where's he go?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK ROBE
dialogues.text: A shrine.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: A shrine? What kind of shrine y'all got?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK ROBE
dialogues.text: Shrine that wash 700 year of sin.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Hey, that's a pretty good shrine, right, Chief? Chief keeps praying, off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I hit you, man. I was scared for Troy, I don't want nothing to happen to him, he's my friend. Chief? Come on, man, I know you was comin' to help me -- Vig reaches out blindly for Chief's hand. Chief looks for a moment at Vig's hand in the air, reaching, then takes it. They remain silent for a moment, hands clasped. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 86.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Thanks man, I don't wanna hold no grudges. Maybe we got kicked out of the ring of Jesus fire.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: That's not how it works.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: How does it work?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I take care of what Jesus puts in front of me; I don't ask no questions. He put the gold in front of me, I took it.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: What about now? Archie walks up, his arm bandaged, and inspects Vig's fac

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: How you doing, Conrad? Vig says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: It was my choice today. You can try to head back if you want, take your share and bury it, I'll find Barlow myself. They look at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I'm here, I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I want to find Troy.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Okay. Let's check the suitcases.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE, CHIEF AND VIG
dialogues.text: check the Vuitton suitcases, opening them, looking at the gold, shutting them. PAN TO children in bandages watching Archie inventory the gold. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 138 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 87.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: We're missing 28.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: That leaves 92 suitcases, three bars each -- They think.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: 23 million dollars. Not bad for a disaster, provided we can find Barlow and not get court- martialled. He looks at Chief and Vig. The Man in Glasses (Amir) puts oil on his little girl's face, they are both crying.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: How is she? Amir does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: How -- is -- your -- little -- girl? Vig wears his eye bandage; he mimes the girl.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Broken -- arms. Girl.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: She's traumatized, what the fuck do you expect? But maybe I should thank you for saving what's left of our lives. They look at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: I went to B-school at Bowling Green. I speak English, okay?

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: What's B-school? Is that like terrorist training?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Business school, Conrad. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 88.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: I came back to open a couple of hotels near Karbala. I'm almost in the black when this stupid war starts and you guys bomb the shit out of my cafes. Now we try to get rid of Saddam, Bush leaves us twisting in the wind, un-be- fucking-lievable, man.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN WESTERN CLOTHING
dialogues.text: (shrieks hysterically) Why do President leave us now? There are too many bodies, we don't have medicine --

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN WESTERN CLOTHING
dialogues.text: (screams ) Where is the army now? Where is America now?

dialogues.speaker: TRADITIONAL WOMAN
dialogues.text: (shrieks) Stay with Saddam, see what you get. The Twins pace nervously, covering their ears. Archie, Chief, Vig are watchful as people scream.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You got a radio?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: No radio. No water. He wipes bits of white foam from the corners of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Where's Barlow?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: They got him, I saw it happen.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Where would they take him?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Oasis bunker. It's full of Saddam's hardcore guys.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Where's that? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 89.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Like 17 -- 18 klicks from here.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Take us there.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: We got no wheels.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We'll walk until we find some.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Why don't you call in the Marines?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: With what? We don't have a radio.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Okay, we'll find a vehicle. You drive back to get the choppers, then fly in to get your man. Chief and Vig look at Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Why not? You got a huge army here.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We're not supposed to be involved with the uprising. We killed Iraqi soldiers. We broke the peace accord.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: You know what I think? I think maybe you're stealing the gold. That's what I think. We're fighting Saddam and dying and you're stealing gold. Archie looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You're wrong. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 90.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: They got half a million men in the desert, they send four guys to pick up all this bullion? I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We need to find our man. How much do you want to take us there?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Is it still yours to give? The only reason you have these bags is my people picked them up. Archie looks at Chief and Vig.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: We take our share. We'll help you carry your share.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: And you take us to our man.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Amir Abdulla. He extends his hand. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Archie Gates.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: After we get your man, you will take us to the Iranian border.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: We gotta get to a refugee camp or we're dead. The nearest camps are in Iran.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You don't need us. You can buy your way over.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: No. Saddam's soldiers will never take his gold. The only chance we have is if we are with Americans. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 91.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: We can't go to the Iranian border.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Then we don't have a deal.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Give me a fucking break, man.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: We saved your life.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: And we saved yours.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We lost a man for you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 92.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: What good is it if you leave us to get wasted? The big army of democracy beats the ugly dictator, saves the rich Kuwaitis, but you go to jail if you help us escape the same dictator. You saw what happened to my wife. Look at my daughter. Archie looks around. He sees Amir's Daughter, other bandaged children looking at him. A few mothers.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Who's going?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Everyone but the priests. That's 55.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Who will take us to the Oasis Bunker? He holds up a gold bar. Fifty civilians turn and look at him silently.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: This is a human life we're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: (laughs) Tell me about it. His daughter looks at him and laughs -- until her laughter becomes scary, hysterical and Amir tries to hold her still, and she won't stop as Archie, Chief and Vig watch.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: If Saddam didn't invade Kuwait, your son would still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. So why you leave Saddam here?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I don't know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 93.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: You think I want to be here? You think I want to do this. But I have to.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I can help your family.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I will. I could help you. Sa'id listens.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: You can get a house, just like mine. No bombs. Door opens -- MAJOR comes in.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR
dialogues.text: Did you get the answer?

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR
dialogues.text: (to Troy) Are they coming back?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR
dialogues.text: Why did you take the prisoners?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It was an accident. The Major raises his hand to strike Troy, but doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR
dialogues.text: (to Sai'd) Get the answer for Saddam, make sure. The Major leaves.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: I got training and guns from America. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 139 140 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 93a.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, how you think I learn English, man? Specialist guys come to Iraq, train us when we fight Iran.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What did they train you in?

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Weapons, sabotage. Interrogation.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: I only join Saddam Hussein army because I have to or he put me in jail. So now I get some money for my family, to make good living for family, good house.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I joined for the extra cash, too. I found out I was gonna have a kid. Sa'id lights a Marlboro, exhales. PUSH IN TO CLOSEUP ON Troy's face as the smoke envelops him.

dialogues.speaker: FANTASY
dialogues.text: Debbie looks up and beams as Troy walks into the room. They embrace on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So, what we get from this dirty Iraq war, you and me, huh? Troy holds the naked baby against his naked chest.

dialogues.speaker: TROY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (whispers) I don't know. END OF FANTASY.  THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 93B.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: (laughs) You don't fahking know, right?! (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We all scahmbag soldier who get fahked, right? My son is dead and who knows now what happens to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rug is pulled off the old stone floor, a panel is lifted. Pistols and rifles are pulled out, some of them old. Chief and Vig load and handle the pistols.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Did we save anything from the humvee?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: This bag. 141 142 thru 143 Archie pulls two of the colored footballs from the beat-u He looks at Chief as if to say "Great."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 Archie leads a line of 55 Iraqi civilians across the dese Everyone carries at least one Vuitton bag. Amir carries his daughter. Vig turns to the twin brothers.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Y'all say America is Satan, right? America is Satan?

dialogues.speaker: HAIRDRESSING TWIN
dialogues.text: No! (in Arabic) We just want a hair salon.

dialogues.speaker: HAIRDRESSING TWIN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) A salon!

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: They want to have a salon.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: A salon, a hair salon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: You cut hair?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: They don't care if they cut American hair, Shiite hair, Sunni hair, they just want to get rid of Saddam for a stable democracy.

dialogues.speaker: HAIRDRESSING TWIN
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) You have a terrible haircut.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: He says you got a terrible haircut. Vig touches his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie crouches low to the ground, moving quickly, secretively. He turns and makes a hand signal to Chief, 20 yards away, who turns and makes a hand signal to Vig.

dialogues.speaker: DECOY AREA
dialogues.text: thru A lone Iraqi military truck, mint condition. 147

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Archie, Vig and Chief form a semicircle, surrounding the truck. They are all 40 yards back from the truck.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: This is the United States Army. Come out of the truck with your weapons in the air. Suddenly Vig's PISTOL FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Shit. Sorry. His GUNSHOT BLOWS a HOLE in the Iraqi TRUCK -- which DEFLATES like a huge beach ball, circling wildly until it lies in a heap of collapsed camouflage canvas while fifty yards away -- 55 civilians flip sand-colored blankets off and stand up in the desert to look. Chief lifts the limp canvas of the deflated truck. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: They used decoys to throw off our bombers.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Where are we gonna get a vehicle?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: I know a place that's full of deserters. Maybe they got something.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: You're going to tell me where he is or you're going back to Riyadh.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: He's helping Adriana Cruz, just like you told him to do.

dialogues.speaker: COMPANY CLERK
dialogues.text: She's not here, either.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Who else missing?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Chief's not here.

dialogues.speaker: COMPANY CLERK
dialogues.text: Barlow and Vig are gone, too.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: I thought Major Gates was acting on your orders, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: You don't know where your own fucking men are?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: The war's over, everyone's taking some French leave.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Archie Gates doesn't set up a bullshit interview to take some reservists on French leave. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 148A
dialogues.text: 149 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 97.

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: They got a document out a guy's ass yesterday, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BERM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Some kinda map or secret list or some kinda thing. Horn stares at Van Meter.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Check all the radio transmissions, maybe we'll get their position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie, Chief, Vig, Amir, others now walk among through an emptyarea next to a canal. A villager passes with an old RADIO PLAYING IRAQI POP MUSIC. A few civilians pass and smile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 149 150 THREE KINGS - Rev. 11/28/98 97A.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER
dialogues.text: America!

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER
dialogues.text: America! Friend!

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER
dialogues.text: Freedom! Thank you to America! Deserters and civilians cheer and pat Archie, Chief and Vig on the back as they walk to a bunker built into the side of a small hill. Two Iraqi Deserters come out smiling to embrace a disoriented Archie and Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass through a cluttered room with six cots, down a hallway, to a larger room where two more young Deserters sit watching CNN. There is a defaced poster of Saddam, two peacocks and three monkeys in the room, and the half- eaten carcass of a zebra. Deserters rise and half- bow to Archie.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Where'd you get these animals from? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 98.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: (translates; in Arabic) Where do the animals come from?

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: Kuwait Zoo. (in Arabic) Have some if you're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: This is for you, my friend, to eat if you are hungry. The IRAQI SOLDIER offers a live monkey to Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: They're not barbarians, they're starving.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Radio?

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: No radio.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No radio, no water, but yes, C.N.N. The other Iraqis nod their heads and laugh nervously.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: George Bush get rid Saddam.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: Congratulation! He embraces Archie, who looks at Amir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Would you explain to these gentlemen that we need a vehicle of some kind?  151 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark. With a CLICK, several bare CEILING LIGHTS COME ON. Archie, Chief, Vig, stare in amazement: It's an underground garage filled with nine luxury cars: a Rolls-Royce, a Jaguar, a Mercedes, an Infiniti convertible, two Cadillacs, a white stretch limousine. Deserter #1 smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: From Kuwait. Chief stops at the convertible.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Could I ask a question, man? The Iraqi deserters look at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Does Lexus make this model?

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: No. Infiniti convertible only.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER
dialogues.text: No Lexus convertible.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Exactly what I said.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Listen. We use these cars to go fight Saddam soldiers. Deserter #1 looks at Chief and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: Cannot take.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: What do you mean, cannot take? We kicked Saddam's ass. We definitely take.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We are the United States military. Deserter #1 laughs.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: You're three guys with some civilians and no humvee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 99A.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: Need money. Have no money. To eat. To live. (in Arabic) You got a whole army here.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: He says the Americans have many tanks, many airplanes. We have nothing. The Deserters do not look happy. Amir does simultaneous translation as Archie holds forth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 151 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 100.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Listen to me. We will rise up together.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Rise up together.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Rise up together. Chief and Vig look taken aback as Archie goes messianic.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Look at_us. Working together. Many races, many nations. Tell him, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: We are united. They raise their joined hands together.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: United. George Bush wants YOU --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: To stand up for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: George Bush.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: He wants YOU --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Praise the Lord.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Make the fight for freedom on your own.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, you can.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Go, baby, go. Archie walks around, looking into the eyes of each Iraqi deserter, touching them on the shoulders. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 101.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Then America will follow.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Then they follow.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Then they will follow, brothers.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: God bless America, and God bless a free Iraq. Iraqis burst into cheers. The Hairdresser Twins are going nuts.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: What do you say now, my friend? He puts his hand on Deserter Leader's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: Cannot give car.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Then I guess we'll have to buy them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The luxury cars ride across the desert, single file, Vuitton bags strapped to the roofs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, Vig, two civilians drive.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Judas Priest will pump you, Chief --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: No, no, no. That's just headache music.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: One song. Chief slams in a CD -- TRADITIONAL IRAQI FOLK WAILING PLAYS. The Civilian rifleman in back smiles as Vig scowls.  154

dialogues.speaker: 154A
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie drives. Amir sits in passenger seat with his daughter on his lap; Deserter #1 in back. They listen to IRAQI MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Van Meter, Col. Horn, two lieutenants look at maps. Cathy Daitch sits smoking.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Depending on what he's looking for, he could be in any Iraqi villages in the south.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Does that sound familiar? The villages in the south?

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Maybe you'd remember more clearly if you were lying down. Cathy lies down.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: Okay, I remember, it's coming back now, I remember he said... what a fucking asshole you are.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: He's been my friend for 12 years, so I know he didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: Let me see, maybe it was.. maybe it was... oh yeah, it was me who said it. The Company Clerk runs up and hands Colonel Horn a paper.

dialogues.speaker: COMPANY CLERK
dialogues.text: This is from Barlow's unit in Detroit. It came from his wife.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: (reads) From his wife? What the hell is this?  155 156 157 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civilians finish passing 92 Vuitton suitcases into a trench.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We get our man, we come back to pick up the gold --

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: And my people. Amir hugs and kisses his daughter good-bye and tries to put her, crying, into the arms of an older woman. He lies down and breathes with a hand on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I'm cool. I'm in a ring of Jesus fire.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Wait a second, I want to talk about this plan some more --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: The way a scary thing works is, sometimes it's best not to do it at all, but when you have no choice like now, you do the thing you're scared shitless of, and you get the courage after you do it, not before you do it.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: That's a dumb-ass way to work. It should be the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I know, but that's the way it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACH's "B Minor Mass" plays as the Mercedes, Infiniti, and Rolls-Royce drive across the desert.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: It's a total waste for your army to come to Iraq, right. Troy just looks at him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: It's okay, you can tell me. What did we do? Tell me, you're safe. He turns off the electric shock controls.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I heard about some bad shit that happened in Kuwait.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Yes, bad things happened. I'm not proud of that.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: So who's got the sick country?

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Maybe Saddam is very crazy, right? And then you are crazy to bomb all of Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Too much bombing is crazy, but not saving Kuwait.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: You come here to save Kuwait people?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Really? (to the second Iraqi; in Arabic) Get the oil. Interrogation Guard #2 dips a bucket into an oil drum.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Lots of people in trouble around this world, my man. You don't fight no fahking war for them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: You invaded another country. You can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: Why not, dude?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It makes the world crazy. You got to keep it stable.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: For what? Your pickup truck?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: For stability. Stabilize the region. Sa'id pulls a CD from Troy's pocket and jams it into Troy's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: This is your fahking stability, my main man. Sa'id uses the CD as a ramp to pour crude oil into Troy's mouth from the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty ridge. The Cadillac shoots over it, arcing down toward the bunker, ENGINE ROARING.  163 164 165 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is quiet. A Slim Jim is unwrapped as a Republican Guard slowly raises it to his mouth, bites it, chews, and looks puzzled at the cars approaching in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac drives fast down the approach road to the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Republican Guard outside the bunker stares at the approaching car. A gunner on the bunker roof gets ready. The front door Guard holds his rifle ready, and is joined by another guard. The Cadillac pulls up fast, stops, the driver's door pops open and Deserter #1 pops out.

dialogues.speaker: DESERTER LEADER
dialogues.text: (frantic) Saddam is coming and he's pissed at you for letting him down. He's going to kill everyone. He gets back in the Caddy and takes off to the rear of the bunker. The Guards look a bit freaked out by this.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) That's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Here he comes. They see the black Infiniti coming, followed far behind by the limo with mini-Iraqi flags flying, then the Mercedes, then the Rolls.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: Saddam is coming to kills us.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: Saddam is coming. They shout into the bunker.  166 167 168 169 170 107.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: Saddam is coming to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: Run for your life. Two Republican Guards frantically run by on their way out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five Republican Guards pour out, and take off into the desert on foot, along with Guard #1 and Guard #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The roof guard lets his tripod machine gun fall flat and runs past a trap door, to the far side of the dirt roof and climbs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig hums nervously as he drives around to the right side of the bunker while mellow FRENCH ROCK PLAYS quietly on the CD PLAYER. Twin #1 sits with him. Vig stops 30 yards from the bunker, gets out of the Infiniti with Twin #1. The doors autolock and the ALARM SYSTEM CHIRPS ON. Vig and Twin look back at the car apprehensively as they stroll over to the pile of wood and metal debris close to the bunker, start moving it, Vig suddenly grabs his hand in pain, pulls a splinter out of his finger. He then sees the wide round vent pipe, pulls out a stick of dynamite wrapped in C-4 embedded with nails, nervously drops it to the ground by accident, Twin #1 picks it up, frantically flicks a lighter, Vig drops the bomb into the pipe. Pause; then a MUFFLED EXPLOSION inside the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air vents spray sparks as Republican Guard soldiers scramble in the smokey dimness to get out.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Do you believe it now?

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) He's going to kill us all!  171 172 173 174 175 THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/4/99 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amir and Twin #2 drive the Rolls to the side door of the bunker and park, blockading the side exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four Republican Guards panic as they pile up against the rear entrance, and run the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie and Chief get out of the limo and run past four more Republican Guards streaming from the smoking bunker, coughing and choking and go inside, followed by two civilians in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Republican Guards come out the trap door and point at Vig and the Twin #1 to the side of the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: (screams; in Arabic) Saddam will not kill me. Vig's and Twin #1's eyes widen with fear as they run back to the Infiniti and Guard #7 FIRES a PISTOL at Vig while Guard #8 aims a grenade launcher. Twin #1 FIRES recklessly back at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig runs back to the Infiniti, finds that it is locked as a CAR ALARM VOICE in ARABIC tells him to step away.

dialogues.speaker: CAR ALARM, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Step away from the vehicle. Vig looks inside, sees his big pistol sitting on the front seat. A GUNSHOT SHATTERS the WINDOW, SETTING OFF the car ALARM SIREN. Vig quickly reaches in, grabs his pistol, and bolts just as the grenade launcher nails the Infiniti, bursting it into flames.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus Fire -- He runs with Twin #1 toward the front of the bunker; Salo Twin #1 and Vig FIRING at the soldiers on the roof.  176 177

dialogues.speaker: 177C
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/4/99 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard #8 is hit in the hand -- turns and sees Amir and Twin #2 FIRING from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Fuck it. He climbs over the back and runs into the empty desert behind the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Come on, wait, fuck -- He takes off, too. Amir FIRES after them into the desert, missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie and Chief run past four other Republican Guards fleeing the bunker in the opposite direction. Chief splits off down one corridor, running, while Archie goes down the other. Amir follows after Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief walks down a corridor -- hears banging on a door -- kicks in the door. Amir follows Chief as he enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room cluttered with debris, but there is another door at the far side of the room -- where someone is BANGING - Chief approaches and kicks it repeatedly --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Get back. Chief SHOOTS the lock on the inner door and it finally opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief and Amir look inside and see, in a sunken room, 50 more civilians huddled together.  178

dialogues.speaker: 178D
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/4/99 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guard #9 runs hard down an empty corridor, carrying a stack of new Levis -- he approaches a corner, turns it, smashes into Archie, their heads bashing together in a head-rattling collision. They both land on their asses, disoriented, rubbing their heads. They each scramble for their guns on the floor, Archie's is closer, he reaches for it -- Suddenly the Republican Guard flails at Archie like a windmill. They have a crazy, slapping windmill fight, when suddenly the Republican Guard grabs his stack of Levis and runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig approaches cautiously from the desert, hears an aircraft, and looks up. An Iraqi HELICOPTER comes in fast and OPENS FIRE with MACHINE GUNS --

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God. Vig runs toward the bunker for cover, but is cut off by MACHINE GUN FIRE from the chopper. Shiites FIRE RIFLES up at the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chips of metal and plastic fly off as BULLETS HIT the chopper. ARABIC CHATTER is heard over a CRACKLING RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: 100 feet below --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig, Hairdressing Twin #1, and the six Shiites franticall search for cover. The Chopper FIRES and one of the Shiites running with Vig is hit in the head, thrown by the force of the gunshot into Vig, who goes down, faking it. The Hairdressing Twin also goes down, faking it. Vig lies face down, out of breath, with the dead Shiite on top of him while the chopper hovers above. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 178G
dialogues.text: 179 THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/4/99 111.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Jesus God, I don't want to get hit, please, Jesus, watch over me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The six Republican Guards who took off from the bunker are still running. Their conversation is in Arabic and subtitled in English.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: Let's go back and get them.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: Fuck a donkey, no way.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: There's a chopper, we can do it. He and another Iraqi stop while the other two keep running.

dialogues.speaker: OASIS BUNKER
dialogues.text: They killed your families, you fucking cowards. The tough Iraqi and his partner, sweating profusely, out of breath, split up and head back toward the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief, Amir, and the prisoners run up the stairs towards the front door of the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief and Amir move the civilians to the front door. One of the civilians runs outside and is SHOT by the chopper hovering just outside.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: (to the prisoners) Stay inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie goes down another corridor, kicks open a door -- it's the bathroom full of stolen stuff and cell phones.  180

dialogues.speaker: 182B
dialogues.text: thru 187

dialogues.speaker: 187C
dialogues.text: 188 THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/4/99 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie kicks in another door -- a room with shelves full of large snow globes, thousands of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie runs down the corridor, holding his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amir and Chief climb a ladder leading from the inside ont the roof. Hairdressing Twin #2 stays with the people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief and Amir take positions on the roof. The chopper hovers in front of the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vig and Hairdressing Twin #1 are pinned down by SNIPER FIRE from the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie kicks in a door -- it is pitch black -- an emergency light flickers on and off -- revealing the Republican Guard interrogator and the Iraqi Major at the control table, where one tries to fix the emergency light with a screwdriver -- they reach for weapons. In flickering light -- Archie SHOOTS the Iraqi Major squarely in the chest, then the Republican Guard interrogator -- the only sound is the GUN POPPING and the BULLETS TEARING into their bodies. Archie turns to Sa'id, who stands next to Troy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 182B
dialogues.text: thru 187

dialogues.speaker: 188D
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/4/99 112A.

dialogues.speaker: SA'ID
dialogues.text: It's okay, buddy, we are just talking now -- SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION -- Archie SHOOTS Sa'id in the thigh. The only sound is the PISTOL SHOOTING, FLESH TEARING. Blood thinly splatters across Troy's face as Sa'id grimaces and falls to the floor. The light flicks on a few beats, then off a few beats. Archie rips the wires from the table controls, goes to Troy, unhinges the wire from his jaw. Sa'id writhes in pain on the ground. Archie takes Sa'id's pistol, snaps open a knife, cuts the cord binding Troy to the chair and gives Troy the pistol. Troy sits, stained with oil, blood, tears. Troy notices that he's wet his pants. He gets up, looks down at Sa'id the floor, points the pistol into Sa'id's face, FIRES the GUN repeatedly just to the side of Sa'id's face, into the ground. Sa'id looks terrified, crying. Troy stares back. Troy and Archie look at each other for an intense moment. Troy stares at Archie, out of breath, worked up, about to cry -- Archie stares back at him, tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief is on the roof. He pulls a football bomb out of his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amir distracts the chopper with GUN FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief pulls the fuse and unleashes the football.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper turns to face the ball just as it hits the Plexiglas window and bounces off and up and then EXPLODES

dialogues.speaker: 189A
dialogues.text: thru 193 194 THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/9/99 112B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concussion takes out the interior of the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper wobbles. SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION: The CHOPPER comes CRASHING to the ground in a heap of metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie and Troy run down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 189A
dialogues.text: thru 193

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie and Troy stop at the door. The crowd of civilian prisoners is clustering around them at the door. He looks around.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Keep those people inside.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: (to civilians inside) Stay there, don't move. Troy and Chief take rifles from the wounded Republican Guards. Troy looks around. It is eerily quiet.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
