dialogues.text: (agitated) Where's Conrad? They silently scan the wide open scrubby area with their eyes. The wind blows. Archie points his pistol and scans. Chief points his rifle and scans. Tension mounts. Amir directs the civilians to stay clustered near the bunker.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Keep your fucking guard up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/9/99
194 Do we still have the gold?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Yeah, half of it.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: How are we getting back?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: We got the Rolls. An Iraqui soldier jumps up as Archie knocks him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: You got a Rolls? Hey. Infiniti convertible. He points to the flaming wrecked

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I think he's in shock.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: That's an Infiniti. It's a fucking Infiniti convertible, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Roger that?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Okay, so I owe you a car. in shock. I'm not

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We can talk about this later, okay?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Freeze -- He points his pistol at Amir, walking up from the side. Everyone tenses.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: He's with us. Troy and Amir look at each other his pistol at Amir.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It is quiet; a moment. Troy still points the wind is blowing. You're the guy with the little girl. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/9/99 114.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: He helped us find you.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: All right. You're all right. He hugs Amir. Archie scans nervously.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: How's your girl?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: She's safe. For the moment.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Outstanding. Excellent. How can we help?

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: We had a deal to get us to the border, but we need more vehicles for these people. Troy moves nervously.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: We're gonna work it out. We can do it. We have to work it out.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I'm not sure how. This is a lot of people.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Okay, you choose who we take. You tell the others it's not convenient, they'll have to die. Hey -- where's Conrad? Troy and Archie look at each other. It is silent again. Amir hears a NOISE. They all jerk to the side, weapons pointed. The wind blows, silently. They wait.

dialogues.speaker: VIG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. All right. They all turn to look.  195 thru 210 211 thru 216 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 115.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 195
dialogues.text: thru 210

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru Vig pops up in the desert, 150 yards away. 216

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: You _ made it. Vig comes running.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I_thought that was you. Yeah. Troy smiles as he steps in the direction of Vig. Suddenly a RIFLE SHOT RINGS OUT, Troy jumps. SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION -- Vig is hit in the collar bone, ONLY the SOUND of the BULLET SMASHING his FLESH and BONE. He is jerked, falls to his knees, but gets up, keeps staggering toward Troy, 125 yards away. Troy looks stunned. Archie turns sharply to his right and, in pain, wound bleeding, FIRES a RIFLE. A Republican Guard 150 yards to the side, drops to the ground as Archie and Chief continue to HIT him with GUNFIRE. Troy runs as hard as he can toward Vig.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Cover him. Chief looks around frantically with his pistol pointed. Archie scans the area and directs three civilian riflemen to spread out.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Lock it down. Shoot anything that moves.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Shoot them if they move. Troy runs, catches the staggering Vig in his arms and embraces him. Blood runs from Vig's mouth, onto Troy's shoulder, as Vig tries to talk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: You made it, man -- Troy cries as he runs with Vig in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Help him. Chief takes Vig from Troy's arms and carefully lays him on the ground, cradling his head in his lap. Vig spits blood.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: What happened to the Jesus fire, Chief?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: It's around you right now, man, it works on this side or the other side.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: You never told me that part.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: That's what it's all about.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: I'm going to hell for this.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: I told you we did exactly what Jesus asked us to do, my man, starting with the gold.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Lemme go to one of them shrines that erase the bad you did, cuz I'm going to hell for this --

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: We made the right choice today, Conrad.

dialogues.speaker: VIG
dialogues.text: Yeah, all right, Troy. The hole in Vig's collar bone is pumping out blood. Troy puts his hands over it. Chief looks sad and scared as he tries to turns Vig's head to help him breathe. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 216 217 218 thru 221 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 117.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Dear Lord watch over this man, help him if you can. Our Father who art in heaven -- Fifty prisoners -- children and adults -- sit on the grou near the bunker, watch from afar. Troy stands up looking around helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Help.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: -- hallowed be Thy name, Thy kingdom come, Thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven -- A GUNSHOT RINGS OUT and -- SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION -- hits Troy in the lower right chest -- and comes out again three inches over, piercing a thin piece of his side -- with ONLY the sound of TEARING TISSUE. Troy looks stunned as he is spun around by the shot. Archie spins around in the desert and looks at Troy.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. He runs hard across the desert toward Troy. Troy falls next to Vig and they look at each other. Troy's eyes are wide with pain as he breathes with great difficulty -- rasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His breathing creates an air pocket, crushing his organs to the left side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru LOOKING UP AT Chief, who is saying something to Troy, 221 there's NO SOUND -- except Troy's LABORED BREATHING. The POV TURNS TO the side -- Vig is no longer breathing. Archie and Amir step INTO FRAME. Archie looks down at Troy, opens his waist pack, pulls out a sterile wrapped scalpel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 221 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 118.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Troy's POV TURNS TO the side --

dialogues.speaker: FISH-EYE LENS
dialogues.text: The Jaguar pulls up in SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION. Amir's little girl gets out of the passenger side, SLIGHTLY SLOW MOTION, NO SOUND. Amir scolds her and gesticulates, indicating she should be back with the others where it is safe. The little girl embraces Amir and stares down at Troy over her father's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy's eyes are wide, staring up at the girl as he has great difficulty breathing. Archie rolls Troy's shirt up, exposing Troy's chest, with the bullet wound. Archie points to a spot on Troy's upper chest, near the collar bone -- Chief squeezes a small tube of brown disinfectant gel onto this spot -- the only sounds are the SQUIRT of the OINTMENT and TROY'S BREATHING. Archie looks nervous, then focused as he brings the shiny metal scalpel down. Troy is in great pain as he watches Archie plunge the scalpel into his upper chest. Archie twists the scalpel to open the incision wide -- There is a pronounced HISSING as trapped AIR RUSHES OUT. Huge relief comes over Troy's face as he breathes normally. REGULAR SOUND FADES BACK IN, the first sound is the

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I've been waiting 18 years to get that right. He tears open a short IV tube and plunges the IV into the scalpel hole. There is a small valve on the end of the tube, which he tightens. A GUNSHOT sounds -- Archie turns and looks over --  222 223 thru 224 225 THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/17/99 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five civilian riflemen chase down and SHOOT, at 30 yards, the last Iraqi gunner in the desert. Troy sits up slowly and watches for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru The Twins and Amir wrap Vig's body in cloth while they 22 chant; Troy, Chief, and Archie watch and chant also. Troy cries. Civilian women and children chant and pray around Vig's corpse as it lies in the open trunk of the Jaguar. Troy and Chief do a muted version of Vig's karate arm dance as they look down at his corpse -- only Vig's closed eyes are visible now.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: He wanted to go to one of those shrines.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: (tearful) Did he say that? Chief nods.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: Kajatar in Iran. We can take him. Archie takes Vig's glasses off.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Good. Take him there. Troy tightens Vig's wrapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy sits in a folding chair nearby. He looks pained and uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Air pressure will build up about every fifteen minutes. Release the valve, close it up again. Archie unscrews the valve on the tube in Troy's chest, and AIR HISSES out. Troy looks relieved. Archie closes the valve. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/17/99 120.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: How long can I keep doing this?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Maybe four hours, if you're not bleeding too bad inside.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm really thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: There's no water anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: (to Archie) You're hooked for the call. LATER. Archie operates a radio hooked up to a car battery

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Bolo, this is Brer Rabbit, do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: We're going to jail.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No, we're not. Chief watches, tense.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Bolo, this is Brer Rabbit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walter drives the dune buggy, nude, wearing his helmet with radio attachment. Cruz and Paco ride along. Walter picks up his handset. Archie is heard in a CRACKLING RADIO transmission.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (into radio) This is Bolo, come in.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (into radio) About two clicks outside camp. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/17/99 121.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're about ready for the briar patch, over.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: (into the radio) Right. He looks uncertain, worried. Adriana tries to grab the radio.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Let me talk to him. I want to know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Ma'am, please. I'm transmitting a code goddamn it.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You got me, Bolo?

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I think so -- who handles the briar patch?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You do.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, and the Tar Baby goes to the briar patch if everything's okay, right?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No, the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Right. Shit, I don't remember how the code goes, sir, I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who looks exasperated. He is sweating with a fever and his arm hurts.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I need three personnel trucks and a humvee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: That's a tall order for a secret op, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Talk to my friend Teebaux. Each driver will get 100K.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Did you say 100K?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Roger. Brer Rabbit at 239 North. Add one medavac pack to the order, and be sure to bring the reporter.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Roger. Give me two hours. (turns to Adriana) Don't ever grab my helmet like that, ma'am, not ever. And don't mess with me when I'm working a code.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: is shaken and little green dollars swirl inside the little world, settling upon an early desert oasis, old buildings, palm trees, donkeys, Three Kings, peasants carrying the baby Jesus, and a Mobil gas station. WIDEN to reveal hundreds of snow globes are pulled from the shelves and put into old cloth bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chief cracks open a snow globe with pliers as all the water and dollars drain out. Amir filters the water through a cheese cloth held above an urn.

dialogues.speaker: PLASTIC THREE KINGS AND BABY JESUS
dialogues.text: with the Mobil gas station glistening in the wet palm of Archie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Archie looks at the Three Kings in his hand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 229 230 THREE KINGS - Rev. 2/17/99 122A.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Troy cracks open a snow globe, filters water with an Iraqi civilian. Dozens of civilians are doing the same. Archie passes an urn to some parched civilians who drink the water thirstily. Troy, Chief do the same. Archie turns to Chief.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Let's give them their gold; leave ours buried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Horn, Captain Van Meter, Company Clerk, look at Maps and recon photos. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 123.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: 223 north, we got a possible heavy-duty Saddam bunker there. Cathy lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: We could sweep from there over to the border, sir.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Shouldn't be too hard to spot them if we're lucky. A humvee with Teebaux, Walter, and Adriana Cruz, and Paco drives by behind the oblivious Colonel, leading a convoy of several trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amir and the Twins check the 15 suitcases they have dug u while the trench is recovered by Chief and an Iraqi rebel. The cars are in the b.g. Archie fills a single rusted oil drum with gold bars and tapes it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amir hands two gold bars to a civilian peasant, who takes them and moves on. There are two long lines of civilian peasants patiently waiting to get their gold, as it is handed out by Amir and another civilian, while Archie, Tr and Chief watch. Civilians stash their gold bars inside their clothing and bags.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Tell them to hide it very carefully. No one can see it.

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Hide it carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone sits and waits: Archie, Troy, Chief, Amir, his daughter, 105 civilian peasants. Troy looks pained, then releases the VALVE on the tube sticking through his chest bandage and there is a HISS of AIR. He looks relieved. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 233 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 124.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is the sound of DISTANT MOTORS RUMBLING. An approaching convoy in the desert: three open U.S. personnel trucks (driven by Berm Soldier #5, Camp Soldier #10, and #11) led by a humvee. Archie, Troy, Chief, Amir, his daughter, dozens of civili watch the convoy approaching -- they hold their guns ready. The U.S. Military trucks and the humvee pull up to the bunker. Walter stands in the front of the humvee with Teebaux, both wearing sand goggles as they pull up, along with Adriana Cruz and Paco. Walter salutes.

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: Quelle gonzesse, Archie, you got yourself shot.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Those better be words of sympathy. Three army drivers (Berm Soldier #5, Camp Soldiers #10, and #11), among them the disillusioned infantrymen interviewed by Adriana Cruz earlier, get out of their vehicles, greeted by Chief, Archie, and Amir. Walter walks up, carrying a medical pack.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: You did it, man. We scored. He bangs Troy's fist in greeting.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: What's that weird thing in your chest? PAN TO Chief, as he puts a penicillin IV in Troy's arm. Troy looks at Vig's body, and Walter follows Troy.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. What happened? What the fuck happened?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: We had to take care of something bad we walked into.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: I never saw a dead friend before. Chief puts his arm on Walter's shoulders. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAN TO Adriana Cruz...

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I called you, didn't I? Teebaux pushes an IV needle into Archie's arm and tapes the penicillin sack to Archie's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Did you find the gold?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: No, that's still somewhere in the desert for all I know, but we lost one of our guys helping these people.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: Here's my story, goddamn it, and I don't even want to do it, I mean, Jesus Christ, who cares about a story when these people are so fucked. Starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Shoot the story, help them out.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: What a bunch of fucking horseshit, this story won't help anybody but you and me and you know it -- Paco, let's start with these people over here. She walks off, Teebaux comes up.

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: Where ees bullion at, my man?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Bullion ees buried. I'11 show you after we get these people to the border.

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: Which border?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Iran. Part of the deal. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: C'est super, Archie, you got yourself a pain in ze ass mission of mercy, you stupid fuck.

dialogues.speaker: WALTER
dialogues.text: Sorry I fucked the code, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I doubt they heard us.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, I called my wife, I told her to call the reserve center.

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: Let's beat it out of here, baby. Bach's "GLORIA" PLAYS. Civilians pile into the four open trucks. The lone oil can full of gold is loaded, as well. Amir and his daughter are helped into a truck by Chief. Archie whistles loud from the front seat of the humvee -- which leads the way as the convoy pulls out. Chief, in the back of a truck with civilians, waves. Troy smiles as he sits in the back of a crowded truck with Amir, his daughter, and other civilians.

dialogues.speaker: THREE-TRUCK CONVOY
dialogues.text: along with the luxury cars, led by the humvee, rolls across the two-lane desert road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE BLACKHAWK CHOPPERS are ROARING on the ground as Captain Van Meter, and Colonel Horn board a chopper. Cathy and her cameraman rush aboard the last chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The humvee slows to a halt. Archie stands in the front of the humvee with a rifle at his side -- looking straight ahead -- concerned. Troy, Chief, Amir, and daughter stare ahead, concerned.  237 238 239 240 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 127.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 yards ahead -- a low wall of razor wire. 100 yards beyond it, a few Iraqi tanks are lined up along the border, 100 feet apart, stretching into the distance either way. There are 50 Iraqi ground troops standing at the border station, marked by razor wire on the one-lane road. On the far side of the border, Iranian soldiers with relief workers wearing red crescents wait by white school buses and stare at the American convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie stares at the border, thinking. Amir helps Troy down from the truck. Chief carries the little girl.

dialogues.speaker: TEEBAUX
dialogues.text: What are you seenking?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: I see an opening we can walk through. But it's not wide enough for a truck. Archie gets out of the humvee and looks at the border.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We'll walk them to the border. The Iranians will take them. We'll walk back to the trucks and get out of here. Chief turns and signals to the drivers to come up. Troy takes the safety off his M-16. Three U.S. drivers (Soldiers #5, #10, and #11) get out with their rifles ready. They release the safeties. Teebaux stays back to man the mounted machine gun on the humvee. Iraqi soldiers on the border nervously watch the Americans and the civilians, holding their machine guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS HAIRS PAN FROM Chief, TO Troy, TO Amir, TO Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Make a close group. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AMIR
dialogues.text: (in Arabic; translates) Make a close group; close. 105 civilians empty the trucks and gather in a crowd that walks toward the border. The Twins men carry Vig's body, wrapped in Arabic cloths. Archie, Troy, Chief, lead the crowd single file through a narrow opening in the razor wire. On the other side, the crowd spreads out and keeps walking. Archie, Troy, and Chief walk three abreast, seven feet apart, rifles ready. Amir and Walter are behind, flanking them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civilian children, women, men, as they fearfully walk toward the border. The three U.S. drivers and Teebaux flank the civilians on either side, rifles ready. PAN TO -- Troy suddenly drops to one knee.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Let the air out.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: It's not the air, I don't know what it is --

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: Stay back.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I'm all right. I'm just dizzy or something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iranian soldiers and relief workers stand watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN TO the backs of the Iraqi troops and tanks, and the approaching civilians and Americans, walking in the distance.  243 244 245 246 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 129.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie helps Troy as they walk three abreast with Chief. CHOPPERS are heard in the DISTANCE. They grow LOUDER. Amir turns and looks back. Archie turns around and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three Blackhawk choppers approach from the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE DOLLY Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Double time. He lets go of Troy and starts jogging toward the border. Troy cannot jog, he crouches down, and is passed by the others. The civilians look up at the choppers as they jog Chief and Walter look up also. Archie does not. Teebaux in the humvee swings the mounted gun up to the CHOPPERS as they pass overhead, LOUD. PAN UP TO three Blackhawks hover over everyone's heads and land in the fifty yards between Archie and the border, blocking his path, blowing up dust. Archie, Troy, Chief, Amir, the civilians turn and wince i the blowing sand. Ten U.S. military police jump from the landing choppers, followed by another ten U.S. troops with rifles, includin Berm Soldier #1. Iraqi soldiers watch apprehensively. MP's grab Archie, Troy, and Chief, and pull them away from the civilians. Troy shouts OVER the CHOPPERS.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S. soldiers push the civilians toward the border. The civilians, including the Twins carrying Vig's body, r toward the border unaccompanied by American protection.  247 248 249 thru 250 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 130.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Let them get over the border. Troy pulls away from the MP's, resisting arrest.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Let them get over, wait -- Plastic handcuffs are put onto Troy, behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: I_have to reach this -- Archie and Chief, not resisting, are handcuffed in front --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Put his cuffs in front. He and Chief are pulled away from Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iraqi soldiers take the civilians prisoner, grabbing them, throwing some to the ground. Troy looks over his shoulder at this as Amir's Daughter is ripped from his arms and he is thrown to the ground and dragged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru 250

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Look what's happening. He collapses to one knee.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: Not our mission, Barlow. Troy grimaces on the ground, he can't breathe, but the cuffs prevent him from releasing his valve. American soldiers watch, upset.

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Cut my cuffs -- Captain Van Meter leans down to Troy. He shouts OVER the CHOPPERS .

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN VAN METER
dialogues.text: You fucked me and you're fucked now, so shut your goddamn mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF
dialogues.text: He's gonna die. Troy lies on the ground suffocating. Archie drags the MP holding him as he goes to Colonel Horn.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Ron, give him medical attention --

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: We are not involved in this problem, Major, do you understand me? You are AWOL, you are a fugitive, you are under arrest.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Cut his cuffs. PAN ACROSS Paco taping --

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Turn that damn camera off. He walks up and forcibly pushes the camera to the ground, Van Meter pushes Paco's camera down.

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: That's a 75 thousand dollar camera, fuckwad --

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: What the fuck are they doing here? Cathy fights violently to keep her camera shooting as an MP struggles with her.

dialogues.speaker: CATHY
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch, let go.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I thought she was authorized --

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: They are not fucking authorized, for Christ's sake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy writhes on the ground. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Berm Soldier #1 stares -- upset by what's happening, reaches in his pocket, pulls out a hunting knife, pops th blade, crouches down to Troy, exchanges a look with the M standing by, and cuts Troy's plastic cuffs. Troy reaches with difficulty to the valve on his chest and turns it -- and breathes. Archie looks at Troy, then up at the border.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A civilian SHOOTS an Iraqi guard; in turn the civilian is SHOT and killed. Other civilians are being lined up in a firing squad. Vig's body is dropped in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You're gonna let this shit happen? You want that to be the story?

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: There's gonna be no story, they're shut down, you know my fucking orders. Archie looks at the border as the Twins plead for mercy.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We got the gold.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: We got the Kuwaiti bullion.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Archie pulls away from the MPs holding him and runs toward the lead truck -- where MPs grab and wrestle him down.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Pull that barrel.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Pull it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: An MP jumps into the truck, pushes the barrel over; thirty gold bars spill to the sand. The General looks at the gold. Troy and Chief, held in custody, watch. Adriana watches, looks at Archie. The General makes a "cut" signal to the choppers -- and the CHOPPER ENGINES CUT OFF and WHIR DOWN; it grows quiet. The U.S. soldiers -- holding Walter and the drivers in custody -- stand and watch Archie.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: How much do you have?

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: Four tons. General Horn picks up a gold brick.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Where's it at?

dialogues.speaker: TROY
dialogues.text: Get them over first.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: They helped us get it, Ron. I made a deal, and that's soldier's honor. You can't fuck them now. General Horn looks at Archie.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHIE GATES
dialogues.text: You can return this gold, save some refugees, be a big hero, clinch your star. Everyone stares at General Horn. After a pause, the General FIRES his PISTOL into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Iraqi soldiers freeze as they are about to fire on the civilians.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Roll the cameras. Let's go, Doug. Captain Van Meter and General Horn walk forty yards to the frozen Iraqi soldiers and the terrified civilians. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CATHY DAITCH
dialogues.text: In a morbid tableau these men have recovered some of the gold stolen from Kuwait --

dialogues.speaker: ADRIANA CRUZ
dialogues.text: -- in violation of American policy, saved over a hundred refugees who tried in vain to bring down Saddam Hussein -- Archie, Troy, Chief in handcuffs with MPs, watch. Walter and the other U.S. soldiers watch from afar as Captain Van Meter and General Horn walk into the midst of Iraqi soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here? An older Iraqi general steps forward and salutes.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: We have to talk about this situation. Archie, Troy, Chief, U.S. soldiers watch from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Horn talks to the Iraqi general.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: U.S. soldiers watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Horn and Captain Van Meter walk back toward them. It is quiet. No one says anything. The CHOPPER ENGINES SLOWLY WHINE into gear. Colonel Horn walks over to Troy, Archie, and Chief. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 256 257 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/8/99 135.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL HORN
dialogues.text: You are under arrest. You are going to be court-martialed. And you will show us where the bullion is right now. He walks into a CHOPPER, which is now REVVING at full speed. PAN TO Troy, Archie, Chief turn to the border and watch. Walter, the handcuffed drivers, the MPs and other U.S. soldiers also watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The civilians are released by the Iraqis. They collect themselves and gather in a group. The Twins walk with the rest of the group over the border, with Vig's wrapped body, and is received by the relief workers. Troy, Archie, Chief watch. A U.S. SOLDIER whistles through the LOUD CHOPPERS.

dialogues.speaker: CAMP SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Then another soldier joins in, whistling and clapping. Then another soldier, until all twenty U.S. soldiers and Mps present are whistling and cheering Troy, Archie, and Chief as they stand there while the CHOPPERS THROB. Fifty yards away: Amir holds his daughter, on the Iran side, about to get into a Red Cross bus. Amir and his daughter wave and the Twins wave. Archie raises his handcuffed wrists to wave back; Troy and Chief follow, raising their cuffed hands to wave. FREEZE FRAME. "I Get Around" by the BEACH BOYS KICKS ON.

dialogues.speaker: TEXT OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: “Troy Barlow, Archie Gates, and Chief Elgin were court- martialed and convicted of disobeying orders and the wrongful death of Conrad Vig. They each served eighteen months in a military prison. Adriana Cruz and Cathy Daitch's testimony resulted in reduced sentences. Troy Barlow runs his own carpet company in Torrance, CA."  258 259 260 THREE KINGS - Rev. 1/27/99 136.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I GET AROUND" CONTINUES. Troy excitedly gives instructions to workers carrying out big rolls of carpet. He wears a short sleeved white shirt and a dark tie. His wife gives his two-year-old daughter to him as she holds a new baby and Troy uses a respiratory inhaler.

dialogues.speaker: TEXT OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: "Chief Elgin applied to the U.S. Army Rangers, but was denied. He then turned down Troy Barlow's offer to partner in the carpet business and plans to join Archie Gates' company."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Chief Elgin, wearing nice travel attire and carry a small suitcase, walks along the tarmac with ticket in hand. He shakes hands with three baggage loaders and waves to two more riding in baggage carriers as he heads toward an airplane.

dialogues.speaker: TEXT OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: “Archie Gates became a military consultant in Hollywood."

dialogues.speaker: FILM SET, (MOS)
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES. Archie on a film set, wearing sunglasses, shows an action star how to push away the barrel of a bad guy's rifle.

dialogues.speaker: TEXT OVER BLACK
dialogues.text: "Saddam Hussein is still in power. Iraqi refugees are still in Iran. Late in 1991, Iraq returned the gold to the government of Kuwait... which claimed that some was missing." FADE OUT.
